ſet perpetuate among u yet superſtitions idolatry romiſh error tyrannous oppreſſions maintained practiſed life moſt obſtinately juſtified without leaſt remorſe acknowledgment guilt error tryall death yea though ſo conſcious himſelfe crime wherewith charged procured pardon oxford king hand great seale ſoon beginning tryall made ſo bold ſo peremptory barr yet leſt ſhould imply argue guiltineſſe honourable kind execution scaffold tower hill head chopped inſtead hanging tyburne although ingenious men would imagined blood many soules ſtarved ſeduced deſtroyed time ſuppreſſing preaching ſuſpending ſilencing cenſuring baniſhing godly miniſters lecturer without reall cauſe preſſing booke sport introducing popiſh arminian souldeſtroying error superſtitions innovation prophanations blood body diver thouſands ſhed england scotland ireland unhappy warrs originally occaſioned ſtirred might prevalent enough relent adamantine heart draw forth teares repentance compunction eye ſoule yet ſuch deſperate obſtinacy impenitency ſcaffold never ſo much confeſſed bewayled death theſe bloody crime thoſe trayterous offence juſtly condemned brow braſſe heart ſtone impudently juſtified innocency nay crime utmoſt without demanding pardon god man though tooke enſuing pardon king ſufficient evidence guilt verbatim tranſcribed originall paſſed great seale oxford charles r carolvs dei gratia angliae scotiae franciae hiberniae rex fidei defenſor c omnibus ad quos praeſentes literae pervenerint ſalutem sciatis quod no pietate moti de gratia noſtra ſpeciali ac ex certa ſcientia mero motu noſtris pardonavimus remiſimus relaxavimus ac per praeſentes nobis haeredibus succeſſoribus noſtris pardonamus remittimus relaxamus willielmo laud clerico archiepiſcopo cantuarienſi ſeu quocunque alio nomine cognomine titulo cognitione ſive additione nominis artis locus vel locorum praefatus williamus laud cenſetur vocetur nuncupetur ſive cognoſcatur aut nuper aut ante hac cenſebatur nuncupabatur ſive cognitus fuit omnes omnimodas proditiones tam majores quam minores note crimina leſae majeſtatis quaecunque omnes omnimodas miſpriſiones et concelamenta proditionum quarumcunque per praefatum willielmum laud ſolum vel cum aliquo alio ſive aliquibus aliis qualicunque aut vbicunque aut aliquo modo vel tempore factus perpetratas vel commiſſas nec non omnes omnimodas felonias quaſcunque tam per vel contra communem legem regni noſtri quam per vel contra quaecunque statuta actus ordinationes ſive proviſiones ejuſdem regni noſtri et acceſſaria quarumcunque feloniarum fugam fugas ſuperinde factas nec non omnes omnimodias subvertiones enervationes legum et omnes omnimodas conſpirationes confederationes conſilia auiſamenta note offenſas alia malefacta quecunque per praefatum willielmum laud ſolum vel cum aliquo alio ſive aliquibus aliis subuertione aut enervatione legum aut aſſumendo regalem poteſtatem aut authoritatē aliqualiter aut vbicunque aut aliquo modo aut tempore habita facta da • commiſſa aut perpetrata nec non omnes omnimodas offenſas crimina tranſgreſsiones alia malefacta quaecunque de praemunire aut communiter vocata aut cognita per nomen de praemunire aut pro quo vel pro quibus judicium executio paena aut foriſtactura caſu de praemunire ſive per aliquod statutum de proviſoribus factum editum reddenda exequenda infligenda aut incurrenda ſunt aut eſſent aut fuerint per praefatum willielmum laud ſolum vel cum aliquo alio ſive aliquibus aliis vbicunque aut aliquo modo aut tempore perpetrata facta aut commiſſa et acceſſaria praedictarum offenſarum criminum tranſgreſſionum et malefactorum eorum alicujus aliquorum nec non omnes omnimodas confederationes conſpirationes illicitas convocationes aſſemblationes illicitas verborum prolationes miſpriſiones juriſdictionum uſurpationes exercitia illicita legum fractiones illicitas juramentorum impoſitiones miniſtrationes contemptus negligentias legum violationes mala illicita conſilia aduiſamenta omnes alias offenſas crimina malefacta tranſgreſsiones quaecunque per quodcunque nomen aut per quaecunque nomina idem vel eadem appellata vocata nuncupata ſunt eſſent aut fuerint per praefatum willielmum laud ſolum vel cum aliquo alio aut cum aliquibus aliis qualicunque aut vbicunque aut aliquo modo aut aliquo tempore habita facta perpetrata aut commiſſa et omnia et ſingula eadem aut eorum aliquod vel aliqua tangentia vel concernentia licet idem willielmus laud de aut pro praemiſſis aut eorum aliquo vel aliquibus curia noſtra parliamenti aut aliqua alia curia ſive aliquibus note curiis aut coram aliquo judice vel perſona aut aliquibus judicibus aut perſonis aut aliquo modo aut aliqua via quibuſcunque impetitus judicatus rectatus appellatus adjudicatus condemnatus vtlagatus convictus vel attinctus exiſtet aut non exiſtet aut impetiri judicari rectari appellari adjudicari condemnari vtlagari convinci aut attingi contigerit futuro et omnes ſingulas utlagarias aut verſus praefatum willielmum laud ratione vel occatione praemiſſorum vel eorum alicujus aliquorum promulgatas aut promulgandas ac etiam omnia ſingula judicia executiones paenas mortis paenas corporales impriſonamenta paenalitates foriſfacturas infamias irregularitates defectus ſeu inhabilitates quaecunque aut verſus praefatum willielmum laud ratione vel occatione praemiſſorum aut eorum aliquorum vel alicujus reddita facta habita adjudicata aut impoſita aut impoſterum reddenda fienda habenda adjudicanda imponenda aut exequenda nec non omnes et omnimodas ſectas querelas impetitiones demandas quaſcunque quae no verſus praefatum willielmum laud pro praemiſſis ſive aliquo praemiſſorum habemus habuimus ſeu futuro habere poterimus aut haeredes vel succeſſores noſtri verſus ipſum pro praemiſsis vel aliquo praemiſſorum habere poſſint futuro ac sectam pacis noſtrae quae ad no verſus praefatum willielmum laud ſpectat vel pertinet ſive pertinere poterit ratione praemiſſorum ſive eorum alicujus vel aliquorum et firmam pacem eidem willielmo laud inde concedimus per praeſentes pardonamus etiam remittimus relaxamus per praeſentes pro nobis heredibus succeſſoribus noſtris praefato willielmo laud omnia et ſingula deperdita forisfacturas quorumcunque bonorum et catallorum terrarum poſſeſsionum tenementorum hereditamentorum ſuorum nobis occaſione praemiſſorum aut eorum alicujus qualicunque forisfacta ſive deperdita quorumcunque ſive cujuscunque manibus aut poſſeſsionibus jam existent aut existere debent et eadem bona catalla terras poſſeſſiones tenementa et hereditamenta praefato willielmo laud damus reſtituimus per praeſentes pro nobis haeredibus et succeſſoribus noſtris habendum tenendum gaudendum poſſidendum eidem willielmo de dono noſtro abſque compoto ſive aliquo alio inde nobis haeredibus ſive succeſſoribus noſtris reddendo ſolvendo vel faciendo nolentes quod idem willielmus laud per no juſticiarios eſcheatores vicecomites aut alios ballivos ſeu miniſtros noſtros ratione vel occatione praemiſſorum ſive eorum alicujus moleſtetur vexetur perturbetur aliquo ſeu gravetur et ulterius de vberiori gratia noſtra ac ex certa ſcientia mero motu noſtris volumus et per praeſentes pro nobis haeredibus succeſſoribus noſtris concedimus quod hae literae nostrae patentes ac omnia ſingula eiſdem contenta bonae firmae validae et lege effectuales ſtabunt et exiſtent et abhinc nullo modo vacuae devenerint et quod allocabuntur omnibus curiis nostris et alibi infra regnum noſtrum angliae abſque aliquo brevi ſeu vlteriori mandato ſeu warranto licet idem willielmus laud bonam ſufficientem ſecuritatem de ſe bene gerendo juxta formam effectum cujuſdam actus parliamento domini edwardi tertii quondam regis angliae progenitoris noſtri anno regni ſui decimo tertio editi non invenerit dicto actu de anno decimo tertio regni dicti edwardi tertii aliquo nonobſtante et non obſtante statutis annis ſecundo quarto decimoquarto viceſimo ſeptimo dicti regis edwardi tertii statuto anno decimo tertio regis ricardi ſecundi praedeceſſoris noſtri edito aut aliquo alio statuto actu proviſione aut reſtrictione contrarium praemiſſorum aut eorum alicui quouiſmodo nonobſtante cujus rei teſtimonium literas noſtras fieri fecimus patentes teſte meipſo apud oxon duodecimo die aprilis anno regni noſtri decimo nono archprelates embracing king granting large univerſal pardon treaſons c himſelf prelaticall partie together majeſtie adherent ſorts eternally concluded plead innocency proclaim martyr canonize meritorious saint done yea majeſties royall care ſerious endeavour canterbury looke upon hee highneſſe hee ſtye pestilent filth hath infected state government church common wealth looke upon dependanties hee man onely man hath raiſed advanced thoſe together himſelfe beene author cauſers note raines miſeries calemities groane onely hath brought earle strafford great place imployments fit instrument ſpirit act execute blouay deſignes theſe kingdomes onely brought secretary windebanke place secretary truſt broker pander whore babylon vvho maſter speaker hee onely hath advanced popiſh biſhops ſhall name ſome biſhop manwaring biſhop bath well biſhop oxford biſhop wren leaſt uncleane one theſe men ſhould ſed chriſts flocke wolf devoured sheepe ſhould fed upon mountaines mountaines eaten sheepe happineſſe church zeale god houſe eate biſhops glorious brave martyr went flak defence protestant religion zeale theſe biſhops hath beene eate perſecute church vvho maſter speaker great archbiſhop canterbury hath ſet helme guide ſteere managing project beene ſit foote kingdome theſe tenne yeares laſt paſt rather hee would ſtand hee hath moſt unworthily trucked chaffered meaneſt inſtance tobacco wherein thouſands poore people beene ſtripped turned trade ſerved apprentiſes wee know hee compounder contractor licence putting pay fine feefarme rent uſe trade certainely maſter speaker hee might ſpent time better grace pulpit thus ſharking raking tobacco ſhoppe mr speaker know hath beene charged withall heere houſe crime dangerous conſequence tranſcendent nature leſſe ſubverſion government kingdome alteration proteſtant religion upon bare information onely much come u already upon cleare manifest proofes ſcarce buſineſſe grievance complaint come u place wherein doe finde intermingled twiſted like buſie angry waſpe ſting taile every thing vve day heard report conference yesterday accuſations scottiſh nation hath charged doe know guilty ſame kingdome mr speaker hath beene common enemy goodnes good men ſafe ſuch viper ſhall neere majeſties perſon diſtill poyſon ſacred eares ſafe commonwealth hee ſhould ſit ſo eminent place government thus accuſed know earle straffords caſe man corrupt fountaine hath infected ſtreames till fountaine purged cannot expect cleare channel ſhall bold therefore offer opinion erre error iudgment want zeale affection publicke good conceive moſt neceſſary fit ſhould take reſolution doe ſomewhat ſtrike whilſt iron hot goe lord name houſe name common england accuſe high treaſon deſire lordſhips perſon may ſequeſtred convenient time may bring charge houſe day voted arch biſhop traitor mr hollis ſame day ſent lord accuſe high treaſon immediatly generall without particular charge aſſuring lord convenient time ſhould particular charge exhibited againſt common make good accuſation wherefore deſired lord arch biſhop might ſequeſtred houſe committed hereupon forthwith committed gentleman vſher yet permitted goe company lambeth ſome book read ſuch paper pertained defence againſt scott charge paper greateſt conſequence conveyed away thence burned defaced worthy inquiry maſter hollis report lord finde thus entred common iournall 18 december 1640 maſter hollis reported according command houſe hee delivered lordſhips meſſage lord keeper ſaid lordſhips conſidered meſſage accordingly ſequeſtred lord archbiſhop canterbury parliament committed ſafe cuſtody gentleman vſher houſe lord order commitment thus entered journall 18 december 1640 day ordered lord archbiſhop canterbury accuſed high treaſon houſe common owne name name whole kingdome england committed ſafe cuſtody gentleman vſher attending high court ſequeſtred ſaid houſe untill grace ſhall cleare himſelfe accuſations ſhall laid againſt ſaid houſe proud imperious archprelate cloſeimpriſoned others ſundry yeares remote caſtles forraigne iſlands meerely oppoſing tyranny innovation excluding friend wife child leaſt acceſſe unto priſons iſles wherein exiled comfort reliefe yet ſo impatient reſtraint himſelfe immediatly commitment maſter maxwels houſe chearing croſſe though convenient lodging liberty farre demerited friend free acceſſe viſit yet hee became humble ſuiter houſe peer even wet cold winter ſeaſon warme lodging moſt men judgment wholeſome cold moiſt walkes might liberty goe abroad keeper take ayre liberty himſelfe would never indulge priſoner committed leaſt offence eſpecially notion puritan ſtrange impatience worthy admiration cloſe impriſoned many godly chriſtians miniſters mobſcure hole dungeon without leaſt pity indulgence diver yeares even well petty offence againſt himſelfe ſhould able endure weekes impriſonment charged high treaſon ſelfe againſt king kingdome without petitioning liberty take ayre requeſt ſo unſeaſonable wiſe man condition would demanded parliament juſtice honour could condeſcend ſuit deemed unſeaſonable rejected behold common genius tyrannicall domineering ſpirits none ſo inexorable mercileſſe inſenſible others unjuſt oppreſſions ruffe proſperity none degenerous puſilanimous querulous impatient ſordidly baſe ſtormes adverſity let archprelates ſuddaine downefall pinnacle honour power reſtrained deſpicable condition impatience future admonition lording prelate tyr • nizing grandee carry themſelves moderation place learne good leſſon heathen poet moſt men hight felicity overapt forget clandian rufinum 2 p deſinat elatis quiſquam confidere rebus jnſtabileſque deos et lubrica numen diſcat illa manus quoe ſceptra ſibi geſtanda parabat cuius ſe toties ſubmiſit ad oſcula ſupplex nobilitas digitos ductis inflectere nervi cogitur c aſpiciat ne quis nimium ſublata february 1640 ordered lord parliament lord archbiſhop cant grace ſhal stand comitted tower london pleaſure houſe continue ſtill ſafe custody gentleman vſher houſe till • nday firſt march 1640 letutenant receive grace ſafe cuſtody pleaſure houſe known meane time mr maxwell reſponſible permit goe abroad archbiſhop oſ canterbury earle strafford ſhall come together mr pym returnes acquaints houſe according ability performed command ordered thankes ſhold given good ſervice therein done houſe thus common iournall relates time manner theſe proceeding article againſt canterbury unanimouſly voted houſes fulleſt concurring ſuffrages thoſe member ſince deſerted parliament repaired oxford ſome made bitter invective againſt whoſe mouth muſt ever ſtopped ſuffrages full parliament uttering accuſation againſt wjlljam laʋd archbiſhop canterbvry whereby ſtands charged high treaſon preſented carryed lord mr john pym febr 26 1640 mr pym comming lord barre preſent article ſpake followeth lord commanded knight citizen burgeſſes aſſembled maſter pyme speech common parliament deliver lordſhips theſe article maintenance charge againſt archbiſhop canterbury deſire firſt lordſhips would pleaſed heare article read ſhall endeavour preſent ſenſe common concerning nature charge order proceeding first hath traiterouſly endeavoured ſubvert fundamentall lawes government kingdome england inſtead thereof introduce arbitrary tyrannicall government againſt law end hath wickedly traiterouſly adviſed majeſtie might owne pleaſure leavie take money subject without conſent parliament hee affirmed warrantable law god 2 hee hath better accompliſhment traiterous deſigne adviſed procured sermon diſcourſes preached printed publiſhed authoritie parliament force lawes kingdome beene denyed abſolute unlimited power perſons eſtates majeſties ſubjects maintained defended onely king himſelfe biſhops againſt law hath beene great protector ſavourer promoter publiſhers ſuch falſe pernicious opinion 3 hee hath letter meſſages threat promiſes diverſe wayes judge miniſters juſtice interrupted perverted time meanes aforeſaid hath endeavoured interrupt pervert courſe juſtice majeſties court weſtminſter court ſubverſion lawes kingdome whereby ſundry majeſties subject ſtopt juſt ſuits deprived lawfull righte ſubjected tyrannicall ruine deſtruction 4 ſaid archbiſhop hath traiterouſly corruptly told uſtice thoſe cauſes depending colour eccleſiaſticall juriſdiction archbiſhop high commiſſioner referree otherwiſe hath taken unlawfull gift bribe majeſties subject hath much lie endeavoured corrupt court juſtice adviſing procuring majeſtie ſell place judicature office contrary law statute behalfe 5 hath traiterouſly cauſed booke canon compoſed publiſhed without lawfull warrant authoritie behalfe pretended canon many matter contained contrary king prerogative fundamentall lawes statute realme right parliament propriety libertie subject matter tending ſedition dangerous conſequence eſtabliſhment paſt unlawfull preſumptuous power himſelfe ſucceſſors many canon practiſe ſaid archbiſhop ſurreptitiouſly paſſed late convocation without due conſideration debate others feare compulſion ſubſcribed prelate clerkes aſſembled never beene voted paſſed convocation ought beene ſaid archbiſhop hath contrived endeavoured aſſure confirme unlawfull exorbitant power hath uſurped exerciſed majeſties subject wicked ungodly oath one ſaid pretended canon injoyned taken clergie many laitie kingdome 6 hath trayterouſly aſſumed himſelfe papall tyrannicall power eccleſiaſticall temporall matter majeſties subject realme england place diſheriſon crowne diſhonour majeſtie derogation ſupreme authoritie eccleſiaſticall matter ſaid archbiſhop claimes king eccleſiaſticall juriſdiction incident epiſcopall office archiepiſcopall kingdome doth deny ſame bee derived crowne england hath accordingly exerciſed high contempt royall majeſtie deſtruction diver king liege people perſons eſtates 7 hath traiterouſly indeavoured alter ſubvert god true religion law eſtabliſhed realme ſtead thereof ſet popiſh ſuperſtition idolatrie end hath declared maintained speech printed book diverſe popiſh doctrine opinion contrary article religion eſtabliſhed law hee hath urged injoyned diverſe popiſh ſuperſtitious ceremony without warrant law hath cruelly perſecuted thoſe oppoſed ſame corporall puniſhments impriſonments moſt unjuſtly vexed others refuſed conforme thereunto eccleſiaſticall cenſures excommunication suſpenſion deprivation degradation contrary lawes kingdome 8 better advancing traiterous purpoſe deſigne abuſe great power truſt majeſtie repoſed intrude upon place diverſe great officer upon right majeſties subject whereby procure himſelfe nomination ſundry perſons eccleſiaſticall dignity promotion benefice belonging majeſtie diver nobilitie clergie others hath taken upon commendation chaplaines king meanes hath preferred majeſties ſervice great promotion church ſuch popiſhly affected otherwiſe unſound corrupt doctrine manner 9 hee hath ſame trayterous wicked intent choſen imployed ſuch men owne domeſticall chaplaines knew notoriouſly disaffected reformed religion groſly addicted popiſh ſuperſtition erroneous unſound judgement practiſe ſome hath committed licenſing bookes printed meanes diver falſe ſuperſtitious bookes beene publiſhed great ſcandall religion ſeducing many majeſties subject 10 hee hath traiterouſly wickedly endeavoured reconcile church england church rome effecting thereof hath conſorted confederated diverſe popiſh prieſts jeſuites hath kept ſecret intelligence pope rome himſelfe agent inſtruments treated ſuch thence received authoritie inſtruction hee hath permitted countenanced popiſh hierarchie eccleſiaſticall government bee eſtabliſhed kingdome trayterous malicious practiſes church kingdome hath beene exceedingly indangered like fall tyrannie roman see 11 owne perſon suffragan viſitors surrogate chancellor officer command cauſed diver learned pious orthodox miniſters god word ſilenced ſuſpended deprived degraded excommunicated otherwiſe grieved without juſt lawfull cauſe diverſe meanes hath hindered preaching god word cauſed diver majeſties loyall subject forſake kingdome increaſed cheriſhed ignorance profaneneſſe amongſt people ſo hee might better facilitate way effecting owne wicked traiterous deſigne altering corrupting true religion eſtabliſhed 12 hath traiterouſly endeavoured cauſe diviſion diſcord betwixt church england reformed church end hath ſuppreſt see charge scottiſh commiſsioners againſt canterbury abrogated priviledges jmmunities beene majeſtie royall anceſters granted dutch french church kingdome diver wayes hath expreſſed malice diſaffection theſe church ſo ſuch diſunion papiſts might advantage overthrow extirpation 13 hee hath malitiouſly traiterouſly plotted endeavoured ſtirre warre enmity betwixt majeſties two kingdomes england scotland purpoſe hath laboured introduce kingdome scotland diver innovation religion government moſt part tending popery ſuperſtition great grievance diſcontent majeſties subject nation refuſing ſubmit ſuch innovation hee trayterouſly adviſe majeſty ſubdue force armes owne authority power contrary law procure ſundry majeſtyes subject inforced clergie kingdome contribute towards maintenance doctor pierce biſhop bath wels ſpeech clergy ſet contribution ſtiled bellum epiſcopale adding ever majeſty expreſſed declaration cauſe warre yet truth warre v biſhops war majeſty much wiſdom juſtice made pacification betwixt two kingdomes ſaid archbiſhop preſumptuouſly cenſure pacification diſhonourable majeſty councells endeavour ſo incenſed majeſty againſt ſaid subject scotland thereupon advice ſaid archbiſhop enter offenſive warre againſt great hazard majeſties perſon subject kingdomes 14 preſerve himſelfe queſtioned theſe trayterous courſes hath laboured ſubvert right parliament ancient courſe parliamentary proceeding falſe malitious ſlanders incenſe majeſty againſt parliament word counſels action hath traiterouſly contrary allegiance laboured alienate heart king liege people majeſty ſet deviſion betweene ruine deſtroy majeſties kingdomes doe impeach high treaſon againſt soveraigne lord king crowne dignity ſaid common averre ſaid william archbiſhop canterbury time crime aforementioned done committed hath beene biſhop archbiſhop realme england one king commiſſioners eccleſiaſticall matter one majeſties moſt honourable privie councell hath taken oath faithfull diſcharge ſaid office councellor hath likewiſe taken oath ſupremacy allegeance ſaid common proteſtation ſaving themſelves liberty exhibiting time hereafter accuſation impeachment againſt ſaid archbiſhop alſo replying anſwers ſaid archbiſhop ſhall make unto ſaid article offering proofe alſo premiſes impeachment accuſation ſhall exhibited cauſe ſhall according courſe parliament require pray ſaid archbiſhop may put anſwer every premiſes ſuch proceeding examination tryall judgment may upon every uſed agreeable law juſtice article read mr pymme proceeded specch followeth lord expreſſion scripture preſume either underſtand interpret yet vulgar eye ſeemes aſpect ſomething ſutable perſon cauſe deſcription evill spirit wherein ſaid ſpirituall wickedneſſes high place crime acted ſpirituall faculty soule vnderſtanding exerciſed ſpirituall matter concerning god worſhip salvation man ſeconded power authority learning many advantage make party commits ſutable deſcription spirituall wickedneſſes high place theſe crime lord various nature heynous quality univerſall extent examine theologically ſtand oppoſition truth god found againſt rule faith againſt power godlineſſe againſt meanes salvation examine morally ſtand oppoſition light nature right reaſon principle humane ſociety perceive pride without moderation ſuch pride exalts ſelfe called god malice without provocation malice againſt vertue againſt innocencie againſt piety injuſtice without meanes reſtitution even ſuch injuſtice doth robbe preſent time poſſeſſions future poſſibilities examined lord legall rule civill way ſtand oppoſition publique good lawes land hee found traytor againſt majeſties crown incendiary againſt peace state found higheſt boldeſt moſt impudent oppreſſour ever oppreſſor king people charge lord diſtributed conveyed 14 ſeverall article heard thoſe article generall intention houſe common commanded declare make certaine particuler preparatory examination taken helpe lordſhips houſe caſe lord strafford ſhall runne light touch marking every ſome ſpeciall point venome virulency malignity 1 firſt article lord doth containe endeavour introduce kingdome arbitrary power government without limitation rule law lord againſt ſafety king perſon honour crowne moſt deſtructive people thoſe cauſes moſt perfect power produce effect conſerve cheriſh seminary vertue nutritive vertue vegetable produce ſame principle defect juſtice reſtraining oppreſſion violence firſt brought government world ſet king moſt excellent way government maintenance juſtice kind government receive ſure foundation eſtabliſhment hath ability preſerve ſecure royall power king yea adorne encreaſe 2 ſecond article lordſhips may obſerve abſolute unlimited power defended preaching sermon diſcourſes printed publiſhed upon ſubject truly lord ſeemes prodigious crime truth god holy law ſhould perverted defend lawleſneſſe men holy ſacred function miniſtry ordained inſtruction men ſoules wayes god ſhould ſo abuſed miniſters become trumpet sedition promoter defender violence oppreſſion 3 third article lord judge majeſty diſperſers diſtributers juſtice frequently corrupted feare ſolicitation courſe juſtice execution ſhamefully obſtructed wilfull act juſtice iudge ſo high crime eſtimate law deſerve death burthen guilt doth man lye hath cauſe great number ſuch voluntary wilfull act injuſtice 4 fourth article hee found owne perſon ſold juſtice cauſes depending wicked councell endeavouring make majeſty merchant ſame commodity difference king taking money place judicature ſhould ſell groſſe whereas archbiſhop ſold retaile 5 fift article appeares power uſurped making canon laying obligation subject nature law power abuſed making ſuch canon matter pernitious directly contrary prerogative king liberty people manner preſſing may found fraud ſhuffling concluſion violence conſtraint men forced terrour threatning ſubſcribe power thus wickedly gotten labour eſtabliſh perjury injoyning ſuch oath maintenance neither taken kept good conſcience 6 ſixth article king robbed supremacy papall power exerciſed majeſties subject conſciences perſons eccleſiaſticall juriſdiction claimed incident right law declares proceed crowne herein lordſhips may obſerve thoſe labour civill matter ſet king lawes kingdome doe yet eccleſiaſticall matter endeavour ſet themſelves king firſt procured archbiſhop extrajudicially declared judge publiſhed proclamation whereof hath made king throne footſtoole owne pride 7 lord ſeventh article religion undermined ſubverted popery cheriſhed defended ſeconded power violence ſevere puniſhment upon thoſe oppoſed miſchievous intention ſubtile eager proſecution theſe men hath power eccleſiaſticall commiſſioners starrechamber councell table beene often made ſubſervient wicked deſigne lord 8 may obſerve eighth article great care taken get owne hand power nominating eccleſiaſticall living promotion much miſcheivous much wicked care taken diſpoſing theſe preferment hinderance corruption religion meanes lord king ſacred majeſtie inſtead sermon fit ſpirituall inſtructours hath often invective againſt people incouragement injuſtice overthrow lawes chaplaines beene brought ſervice much may laboured corrupt owne houſhold beene eminent example corruption others hath ſo farre prevailed hath exceedingly tainted vniverſities beene generally diſperſt chiefe city greateſt townes auditories kingdome grievous effect whereof moſt manifeſt common houſe diverſe hundred complaint depending houſe againſt ſcandalous miniſters yet believe hundred part yet brought 9 ninth article ſets like care chaplaines owne might bee promoter wicked trayterous deſigne men corrupt judgment corrupt practice extreamely addicted ſuperſtition ſuch men care hath committed licencing bookes preſſe meanes whereof many beene publiſhed full falſhood ſcandals ſuch beene worthy burnt hand hangman smithfield thinke one admitted come hand king people 10 tenth article appeare made theſe approach popery come cloſe joyne neerely confederate prieſts jeſuites inſtruments negotiates pope rome hath correſpondence authorized rome hath permitted roman hierachie ſet kingdome though hath bin ſo carefull poore man could goe neighbour pariſh heare sermon none home could sermon repeated prayer uſed family fit ſubject high commiſſion court yet hath beene done part realme notice taken eccleſiaſticall judge court lord 11 may perceive preaching ſuppreſſed eleventh diver godly orthodox miniſters oppreſſed perſons eſtates king loyall ſubjects baniſhed kingdome elimelecke ſeeke bread forraigne country reaſon great ſcarcity jſrael travelling abroad bread life becauſe could home reaſon ſpirituall famine god word cauſed man partaker meanes trade manufactury induſtry many thouſands majeſties ſubjects carried land miſerable abuſe ſpirituall keyes ſhut doores heaven open gate hell let prophaneneſſe ignorance ſuperſtition errour ſhall neede ſay theſe thing evident abundantly knowne 12 twelfth article lord diviſion endeavoured betweene forraine reformed church church chriſt one body member chriſt mutuall relation member ſame body vnity god true church every beauty ſtrength religion beauty ſtrength hath ſought deprive church manifold attempt breake union purpoſe hee hath ſuppreſſed priviledges granted dutch french church hath denyed ſame faith religion u many wayes hath declared malice thoſe church 13 thirteenth article hath ſought make eccleſiaſticall diviſion religious difference betweene u forraine nation ſo hath ſought make civill difference betweene u majeſties ſubjects kingdome scotland theis hath promoted many innovation preſt himſelfe owne authority uncapable ſuch alteration adviſed majeſty uſe violence hath made private publique collection towards maintenance warre might juſtly call owne warre impudent boldneſſe hath ſtruck tally exchequer diver ſummes money procured himſelfe pro defenſione regni counſels king drawne undertake defenſive offenſive warre 14 hath laſtly thought ſecure himſelfe party ſeeking undermine parliament thereby hath laboured bereave kingdome legiſlative power uſed parliament ſhould left kingdome without indeed make conſtitutes kingdome meanes preſerve reſtore diſtempers decayes hath hereby endeavoured bereave u higheſt judicatory ſuch judicatory neceſſary eſſentiall government caſes treaſon others concerning prerogative crowne liberty people ſupreame judicatory difficult caſes reſort court hath fought deprive king love counſell people aſſiſtance might likewiſe deprive people reliefe grievance moſt humbly expect majeſtie lord parliament cabinet wherein chiefeſt jewells crowne kingdome depoſited great prerogative king libertie people moſt effectually exerciſed maintained parliament lord cannot paſſe occaſion great thankes god majeſty paſſing bill whereby frequent courſe parliament eſtablished aſſure ſelfe experience finde bee ſtrong foundation honour crowne lord ſay particular charge parliament called ſitting weſtminſter traiterouſly maliciouſly cauſed ſaid parliament diſſolved great grievance majeſties ſubjects prejudice commonwealth ſoone diſſolution thereof gave diver propoſitions hand george duke buckingham caſting therein many falſe aſperſions upon ſaid parliament calling factious parliament falſly affirming caſt many ſcandalls upon majeſty uſed like child minority ſtiling puritan commending papiſts harmleſſe peaceable ſubjects 2 within ſpace ten yeares laſt paſt ſaid archbiſhop hath treacherouſly endeavoured ſubvert fundamentall lawes realme end hath meanes ſolicitations uſed iudges oppoſed ſtopped granting majeſties writ prohibition ſame ought beene granted ſtay ef proceeding eccleſiaſticall court whereby juſtice hath beene delayed hindered ſeverall church ſaid archbiſhop eight yeares laſt paſt wilfully maliciouſly cauſed ſaid gift feoffements conveyance made uſes aforefaid overthrowne majeſties court exchequer contrary law thing dangerous church state ſpecious pretence buying appropriation whereby pious worke ſuppreſſed trodden downe great diſhonour god ſcandall religion 7 ſaid archbiſhop ſeverall time within theſe ten yeares laſt paſt weſtminſter elſe within realme contrary knowne lawes land hath endeavoured advance popery superſtition within realme end purpoſe hath wittingly willingly received harboured relieved diver popiſh prieſts ieſuits namely one called sanctum clara alias damport dangerous perſon franciſcan fryer written popiſh ſeditious booke intituled deus natura gratia wherein thirty nine article church england eſtabliſhed act parliament much traduced ſcandalized ſaid archbiſhop diver conference writing ſaid booke alſo provide maintenance entertainment one mounſieur st giles popiſh prieſt oxford knowing popiſh prieſt 8 ſaid archbiſhop foure yeares laſt paſt ut weſtminſter aforeſaid ſaid muſt blow given church ſuch hath beene yet given could brought conformity declaring thereby intention bee ſhake alter true proteſtant religion eſtabliſhed church england 9 month may 1641 preſently diſſolution laſt parliament ſaid archbiſhop end purpoſes aforeſaid cauſed synod convocation clergie held ſeverall province canterbury yorke wherein made eſtabliſhed meanes procurement diverſe canon conſtitutions eccleſiaſticall contrary lawes realme right priviledges parliament liberty propriety subject tending alſo ſeditior dangerous conſequence amongſt thing ſaid archbiſhop cauſed moſt dangerous illegall oath therein made contrived tenor whereof followeth theſe word b doe ſweare approve doctrine diſcipline government eſtabliſhed church england containing thing neceſſary ſalvation endeavour ſelfe directly indirectly bring popiſh doctrine contrary ſo eſtabliſhed ever give conſent alter government church archbiſhops biſhops deanes archdeacon c ſtands eſtabliſhed right ought ſtand yet ever ſubject uſurpations ſuperſtitions sea rome theſe thing doe plainly ſincerely acknowledge ſweare according plaine common ſenſe underſtanding ſame word without equivocation mentall evaſion ſecret reſervation whatſoever heartily willing truely upon ſaith chriſtian helpe mee god jeſus chriſt oath ſaid archbiſhop himſelfe take cauſed diverſe miniſters church take ſame upon paine ſuſpenſion deprivation living ſevere penalty alſo cauſe godfrey biſhop glouceſter committed priſon refuſing ſubſcribe ſaid canon take ſaid oath afterward ſaid biſhop ſubmitting himſelfe take ſaid oath ſet liberty 10 little calling laſt parliament anro 1640 vote paſſed reſolution taken councell table advice ſaid archbiſhop aſſiſting king extraordinary wayes ſaid parliament ſhould prove peeviſh refuſe ſupply majeſtie ſaid archbiſhop wickedly malitiouſly adviſed majeſtie diſſolve ſaid parliament accordingly ſame diſſolved preſently ſaid archbiſhop told majeſty abſolved rule government left free uſe extraordinary wayes ſupply matter thing ſaid common aſſembled parliament name themſelves common england doe impeach ſaid archbiſhop canterbury high treaſon crime miſdemeanours tending ſubverſion religion lawes liberty utter ruine church commonwealth ſaid common proteſtation ſaving themſelves liberty exhibiting time hereafter accuſation impeachment againſt ſaid wil laud archbiſhop canterburie alſo replying anſwer ſhall make unto ſaid article offering proofe premiſſes impeachment accuſations ſhall exhibited cauſe ſhall according courſe parliament require pray ſaid wil laud archbiſhop canterbury may called anſwer ſaid ſeverall crime miſdemeanors receive ſuch condigne puniſhment ſame ſhall deſerve ſuch proceeding may bee upon every uſed againſt agreeable law juſtice theſe additionall article ſent common lord houſe maſter serjeant wilde 23 october 1643 whereupon lord made enſuing order die luna 23 octob 1643 ordered c lord archbiſhop canterbury ſhall put anſwer writing houſe thirtieth day inſtant october unto particular article maintenance former impeachment high treaſon diverſe high crime miſdemeanours brought houſe common againſt remaining lord parliament archbiſhop ſerved order ſame day next morning ſent petition written owne hand lord honourable lord aſſembled high court parliament humble petition william laud archbiſhop canterbury humbly sheweth hath received lordſhips order october 23 1643 coppie article charged againſt requiring make anſwer moſt humbly prayeth according order honourable houſe may councell aſſigned maſter hearne maſter chute may bee councell free liberty come unto may ſome money eſtate fee councell defray charge beene last whole yeare burdenſome friend may paper bookes moſt belong defence maſter prynne tooke order lord delivered unto may able anſwer himſelfe alſo may time mean ſend witneſſes hardly done time limited may ſervants ſend neceſſary occaſions laſtly may longer time article large many ſhall ever pray c note william cant petition read lord houſe october 24 1643 thereupon order framed die marti 24 october 1643 vpon reading petition lord archbiſhop canterbury day houſe ordered c time given untill munday ſixth november next putting anſwer writing houſe unto particular article brought houſe common maintenance former impeachment high treaſon diverſe high crime miſdemeanours againſt maſter heron maſter chute hereby aſſigned councell drawing anſwer bee permitted free acceſſe houſe doth hereby recommend committee sequeſtrations ſaid lord archbiſhop ſhall ſuch meanes aforded eſtate enable pay councell defray charge lordſhip ſhall ſet particularly paper writing neceſſary defence ſhould reſtored unto lordſhips take conſideration upon lordſhips nominating ſhall solicitor lord returne anſwer witneſſes day ſhall appointed lordſhips tryall houſe give ſuch direction therein ſhall juſt die sabbati 28 october 1643 ordered c maſter hale hereby appointed councell lord archbiſhop canterbury councell already appointed drawing anſwer charge houſe common againſt maſter w dell maſter richard cobb maſter george smith lordſhips ſervants ſhall liberty attend ſaid archbiſhops ſeverall affaire permitted come unto ſhall occaſion october 31 hee exhibited petition lord right honourable lord aſſembled parliament humble petition william archbiſhop canterbury moſt humbly seweth petitioner preſented againſt honourable houſe common lordſhips impeachment intituled farther article impeachment common aſſembled parliament high treaſon diver high crime miſdeamenours honorable order twentie fourth october annexed directed put anſwer writing munday ſixth november hath thereby councell aſſigned draw ſame petitioner councell upon reading article finding well frame concluſion thereof matter crime miſdemeanours ſo interwoven reference matter thereby charged treaſon cannot take upon distinguiſh conceiving bin lordſhips intention aſſignments ſhould adviſe anſwer part impeachment charged againſt petitioner treaſon doe forbeare adviſe petitioner anſwer ſaid article without ſome declaration firſt ſaid article intended charge high treaſon crime miſdemeanours without petitioner like deprived aſſiſtance councell granted lordſhips order petitioner humbly beſeecheth lordſhips ſo heavy charge upon ſo great honourable body ſuch ſtraight time may declared ſaid article intended charge crime miſdemeanours petitioner may aſſiſtance councell aſſigned adviſe anſwer thereunto lordſhips honourably pleaſed note inlarge petitioner time allotted anſwer petitioner ſhall pray c william cant vpon petition order formed die marti 31 october ordered c lord archbiſhop canterbury ſhall time put anſwer impeachment houſe common untill munday thirteenth october next houſe doth forbeare declare opinion concerning ſeverall article ſaid impeachment leaf councell doe adviſe councell ſhall thinke moſt fitting day given order put anſwer till 13th novenmber following order made purſuance thereof die veueris 10 november 1643 ordered leiutenant tower london deputie ſhall bring ſafety lord archbiſhop canterbury lordſhips munday 13th inſtant november ten clock morning put anſwer houſe impeachment houſe common remaining lord parliament ſufficient warrant behalfe gentleman vſher c 13 november canterbury councell ſhall provide themſelves adviſe point law article whole charge matter fact cauſe come preſented houſe common ſhall need lordſhips give direction due time 1 • december 1643 houſe common deſirous bring archbiſhop ſpeedy tryall made enſuing order 11 december 1643 ordered committee tyrall archbiſhop canterbury doe meete afternoone 2 clock starchamber prepare evidence againſt archbiſhop cant ſummon ſuch witneſſes need full prepare buſineſſe fit tryall acquaint houſe ready doe convenient ſpeed power ſend party witneſſes paper record c care thereof particularly committed unto serjeant wild upon committee met ſundry time prepare evidence 3 january following lord intending expedite archbiſhops tryall according common deſire made order die mercurii 3 ian 1643 day ordered lord parliament houſe proceed againſt william laud archbiſhop canterbury upon impeachment brought houſe common high crime miſdemeanours munday morning next ten clock eight inſtant ianuary 1643 time ſaid archbiſhop prepare himſelfe defence gentleman vſher attending houſe deputie delivered leiutenant tower deputie archbiſhop whereupon lord ſame day ſent downe meſſage common thus entred iournall 31 ianuary 1642 meſſage ſent lord sir robert rich mr page lord commanded u put minde archbiſhop canterbury hath put plea impeachment houſe ſent lord ſometimes ſince deſire take conſideration fit done 5 ianuary houſe common deſired lord appoint committee examine ſome witneſſes upon oath againſt archbiſhop preſence committee common granted common made order 5 ian 1643 ordered committee houſe formerly appointed buſines archbiſhop cant ſhall committee preſence witneſſes caſe biſhop cant examined upon oath committee lord 6 ianuary archbiſhop preferred petition lord deferring tryall ſome longer time entered iournall 16 ianuary 1643 meſſage lord sir robert rich mr page acquaint houſe ready heare charge upon impeachment againſt biſhop canterbury vpon meſſage committee houſe common appointed mannage evidence againſt went lord houſe archbiſhop brought barre kneeled little ſpace commanded ſtand ceremony ended mr maynard one committee deſired lord originall additional article impeachment againſt archbiſhop might read read accordingly clerke prayed archbiſhops ſeveral anſwers theſe article might likewiſe read whereupon speaker lord houſe commanding read clerk read forementioned anſwer additionall article noe anſwer originall never anſwer put unto archbiſhop al time reſtraint 26 feb 1640 till houre ſo much tendered put anſwer originall article owne meere default never ſo much petitioned ſpace brought tryall notwithſtanding frequent complaint long impriſonment delay hearing occaſioned owne neglect petitioning longer time common haſtned tryall hereupon mr maynard ſpake lord effect lord new appeares lordſhips unwilling archbiſhop conſciouſneſſe owne guilt come tryall ſpace firſt impeachment hath ſo much put anſwer originall article though long ſince councell aſſigned purpoſe lord none common fault owne lordſhips well know common take notice done houſe peeres parliamentary way meſſag lordſhips articls exhibited cal upon archbiſhop anſwer lordſhips ſending u ſeveral meſſages heretofore archbiſhop put anſwer articls ready heare charge appointing day tryall common thereupon conceived formerly put plea anſwer due forme 〈◊〉 article contrary appearing lordſhips impoſſible u proceed time tryall iſſue ioyned upon originall article want anſwer 〈◊〉 upon additionalls anſwer given originalls prepoſterous • therefore • e humbly prey lordſhips order archbiſhop may forthwith put anſwer •• th originall additionall article advice councill otherwiſe ſuch ſort stand ſhall without delay joyne 〈◊〉 proceed tryall evidence againſt lordſhips ſhall appoint archbiſhop archbiſhop cant firſt article houſe common dilivered 22th january 1643 humble anſwer william archbiſhop cant firſt farther article impeachment brought honourable houſe common againſt order right honourable lord parliament 16 inſtant directed put 13 article ſaid firſt article matter therein charged allmatters thing ſame reſt ſaid article contained concern act hoſtility whether king subject subject subject may conceived ariſe upon comming engliſh army againſt scotland comming scotiſh army england upon action attempt aſſiſtance councell deviſe relation thereunto falling occaſion late trouble proceding late concluſion treaty returne scottiſh army scotland defendant ſaith enacted act made ſitting preſent parliament ſame whatſoever hath enſued thereupon whether treuching upon lawes liberty church kingdome upon majeſties honour authority time hereafter may called queſtion reſented wrong nationall perſonall mention made thereof time comming neither judgement judgement held reputed though never ſuch thing beene thought wrought ſaid act may large appeare defendant doth averre none perſons excepted ſaid act ſaid offence charged upon defendant offence excepted ſaid act reſt ſaid firſt article defendant ſaving himſelfe advantage exception ſaid article humbly ſaith guilty matter ſaid article charged ſuch manner forme u ſame ſaid article charged againſt vv cant ſame day find entry common iournall wit 22 jan 1643 lord sir robert rich mr page ſent downe anſwer william archbiſhop cant firſt article impeachment brought houſe againſt read ordered referred commitmittee appointed manage evidence againſt archbiſhop canterbury accordingly delivered serjeant wilde houſe common expedite tryall 22 february 1643 ordered committee appointed mannage evidence tryall archbiſhop canterbury doe peremptorily meete afternoone three clocke court ward upon diſtribution part evidence common lord ready tryall given much convenient time prepare himſelfe witneſſes could deſire prevent clamour prelaticall canterburian party began thinke peremptory day tryall thereupon finde order entred common journall 4 marcii 1643 meſſage ſent lord deſire appoint day tryall biſhop canterbury maſter serjeant wilde went lord appoint day tryall archbiſhop canterbury serjeant wilde brings anſwer lord appointed morrow ſenight tryall archbiſhop canterbury purpoſe lord made following order die lunae 4 marcii 1644 ordered archbiſhop canterbury ſhall appeare lordſhips tueſday 12th inſtant march nine clock morning time houſe proceed againſt archbiſhop upon firſt article impeachment brought houſe common againſt high treaſon high crime miſdemeanours whereof ſaid archbiſhop hereby take notice provide himſelfe accordingly archbiſhop petitioning common houſe sir henry midmay member thereof might bee examined witneſſe tryall order thereupon conceived 9 marcii 1644 humble petition william archbiſhop canterbury deſiring sir henry mildmay may examined witneſſe buſineſſe come tryal tueſday next day read ordered according petition ſhall examined witneſſe tryall ſaid biſhop accordingly likewiſe ordered diverſe member houſe common ſhal examined witneſſes againſt lord moved serjeant wilde ſome member attendant lord houſe examined archbiſhops tryall referred committee sequeſtrations conſider ſome convenient recompence ſuch clerk sollicitors others ſhall bee imployed transſcribing breviats ſervices done committee biſhop canterbury tryall 12 march tryall according former order entred upon ſhall give ſummary account never age ſuch deliberate ſolemne patient impartiall hearing caſe high court parliament court juſtice elſe kingdom whatſoever archbiſhops firſt day tryall began twelfth march 1643 wherein whole time ſpent reading article impeachment anſwers introductory speech charge evidence againſt made serjeant wilde archbiſhop himſelfe firſt part evidence upon 1 2 3 4 originall 2 3 4 10 additionall article managed iohn maynard eſquire one common houſe wherein foure whole dayes namely march 13 16 18 anno 1643 march 28 1644 ſpent forenoon evidence proof afternoon archbiſhops anſwers maſter maynards replyes unto ſecond part evidence proſecuted robert nicholas eſquire member houſe common took three whole dayes viz aprill 16 may 4 16 morning evening proof fifth ſixth originall ninth additionall article anſwers replyes upon third part touching religion contained 7 8 9 10 11 12 originall 6 7 additionall article carried managed iohn wilde serjeant law common houſe 4 whole dayes wit may 20 27 iune 6 11 reaſon mr serjeant ſickneſſe infirmity purſued maſter nicholas 5 intire dayes viz iune 17 20 27 iuly 20 24 fourth laſt part evidence proof 14 originall 1 10 additionall article given maſter nicholas 29 iuly concluded ſame day evidence ſelf excellently well preſſed theſe learned gentleman took ſeventeen whole day morning evening beſides 12 dayes attendance whereon preſſing publike affaire enforced lord adjorn tryall committee common ready witneſſes archbiſhop preſent councell ready receive charge evidence anſwers replyes thereto fully given archbiſhop liberty granted make recapitulation whol defence lord accordingly performed ſecond september 1644 samuel brown eſquire member houſe common replyed 11 september ſumming principall part evidence given againſt lord bar 11 octob 1644 archbiſhops councell heard lord bar point law formerly directed ſpeak whether article charged againſt treaſon contained mr iohn hern onely argued mouth reſt councell soon common drawn ordnance attainder high treaſon againſt archbiſhop upon evidence given againſt ſecond novemb following archbiſhop ſecond reading brought common bar mr sam brown preſence ſummed evidence given againſt lord archbiſhop order gave anſwer vivâ voce common bar nov 11th whereunto mr brown replyed 13th ſame novemb ſame day ordinance attainder high treaſon paſſed common houſe without diſſenting voyce one upon matter charge high treaſon voted guilty manner proceeding onely ordinance tranſmitted houſe peeres becauſe ſome lord preſent evidence given againſt long tryall thereupon decemb 4 1644 ordered book writing docquets evidence concerning archbiſhop canterbury tryall lord parliament ſhould brought clerk parliament 9 clock morning saturday next done accordingly lord among themſelves ſeriouſly reexamined head principall part evidence formerly urged againſt bar debating weighing voting particular went moſt ſerious review lordſhips upon moſt mature deliberation voted guilty article matter fact charged againſt alſo high treaſon notwithſtanding argument archbiſhops councel upon conference houſe common ſatisfied point law whereupon paſſed ordinance attainder high treaſon vertue whereof ſoon executed whereof fully due place thus ſumme lord common moſt deliberate fair moderate juſt though tedious proceeding againſt archtraytor preſidented preceding age fit imitated future regard length expence time againſt calumny malice ſelfe take juſt exception behalfe rather becauſe himſelfe would tried condemned executed hundred paritans halfe time wherein trying without leaſt mercy moderation beene brought tribunall farre pettie treaſons thoſe hee attainted voted guilty upon moſt full pregnant evidence given world briefe account fairenes deliberateneſſe tryall ſo long delayed partly neglect pleading article impeachment petitioning brought tryall time reſtraine partly owne forementioned petition lord longer time common preſſed expedite hearing partly death mr john pym ſome member common houſe truſted prepare mannage evidence againſt part whereof miſcarryed deceaſe principally reaſon great intervening urgent affaire diſtractions bloody war kingdomes ireland england occaſioned majeſties deſerting parliament archprelates plot ſet popery neglect default lord common ſhall next endeavour yeeld full ſatisfactory true account proceeding evidence given againſt tryall really render archeſt traytor moſt peſtilent malefactor kindes villany tyranny oppreſſion miſchiefe ever arraigned condemned parliament pierce graveſtons archbiſhop arundles cardinall wolſes empſons dudlies earle straffords treaſons conſpiracies oppreſſions grand miſdemeanours layd together far inferiour inouſneſſe multiplicity variety ſhall undeniably demonſtrated world ſubſtantiall proofes thurſday 12 march 1643 day deſigned comencement great tryall three clocke afternoon archbiſhop brought priſoner lieutenant tower london uſher blacke rod bar lord houſe kneeled knee litle ſpace lord gray warke speaker honourable houſe commanded riſe done committee houſe common appointed mannage evidence tryall demanded ſeverall article impeachment againſt might read whereupon one clerkes lord houſe read originall additionall article forementioned anſwer plea demurrer read archbiſhop deſired lord houſe common might give charge evidence article againſt together ſhould put give anſwer particular charge becauſe ancient memory ſhort article generall might anſwer charge together dayes evidence peecemeale maſter maynard behalfe common anſwered 1 archbiſhops memory ſo bad pretended would far worſe charge anſwering many particular whole evidence againſt together anſwer every particular charge day ſhould given againſt while freſh memory 2ly might would great inconvenience witneſſes croſſeexamined upon dayes thoſe whereon gave teſtimony againſt priſoner 3ly lord themſelves would finde difficult paſſe judgement upon charge together without hearing punctuall anſwer every particular proof ſhould given evidence while freſh memory 4ly becauſe elſe witneſſes many muſt neceſſity attend kept town firſt laſt day tryall would great charge inconvenience 5ly earle straffords caſe parliament put anſwer every day particular evidence given againſt fabricata c et ſuper illis cerei albi quorum medio locabitur crux ex eodem metallo opere praealta ita ut pe crucis aequet altitudinem vicinorum candelabrarum crux ipſa tota candelabris ſuperemineat sepi atur omnino ſepto ferreo vel lapideo vel ſaltem ligneo quod ſeptum ab altari diſtet ſaltem police ſeptem nec vero ſeptum illud laicus ingrediatur dum miſſae ſacrificium fit habeat unumquodque altare propriam ſuperlectilem ornamenta decentia tum ad ejus cultum uſum tum ad miſſae ſacrificium eo religioſe decenterque peragendum altaria ſingula ornata ſint cruce medio collocata niſi aliquae archbiſhop uſed conſecration exaude domine pater clementiſſime precos noſtras haec purificanda vaſa ornamenta ſacri altaris atque eccleſiae tuae ſacri miniſterij uſui praeparata benedicere ſanctificare digneris per chriſtum dominum nostrum amen omnipotens ſempiterne deus quo omnia immunda purgantur quo omnia purgata clare ſcunt ſupplices omnipotentiam tuam invocamus ut ab vaſis ornamentis quae tibi offerunt famulus tui omnis ſpiritus immundus confuſus longè diſcedat per tuam benedictionem ad uſum miniſterium ſancti altaris eccleſiae tua ſanctificata permaneant per chriſtum eccleſiae b mariae virginis unà conveniant ijſque ſic congregatis preces divinae ab ejuſdem eccleſiae paraecialis vicario aut illius deputato ſolenniter habeautur quibus peractis primum vicecancellarius poſteà ſinguli inceptores facultatibus deinde procuratores bedellis praecuntibus ad menſam euchariſtiae ſacram cvm debita reverentia word practiſe interpreted lowly bowing towards oblationes faciant quod ſi quis precibus ſole nuibus oblationibvs abſens fuerit aut praeſens cum debit reuerentia ad men eucharistiaae sacram accedere recuſaverit puniatur pro arbitrio vicecancellarij uſually reſorted thither ſome curioſity behold others learne practiſe popiſh ceremony order uſed chappell common report among schollers houſe others none might approach altar peter houſe sandalls ſpeciall conſecrated knife kept upon altar cut ſacramental bread conſecrated maſter lazarus seman depoſed left vniverſity cambridge ten yeares ſince time none forementioned innovation ſo much known uſed late time beene introduced many witneſſes ready depoſe like innovation kinde ſo notoriouſly knowne ſo fully proved parliament maſter peter smart article againſt doctor coſins common thought produce witneſſes herein would bee meere miſpence time purpoſe tyre lord auditory perchance archbiſhop object theſe innovation vniverſity object cambridge unto neither chancellor councell countenance immediatly introduced anſwer anſwered 1 publike example practiſe chappell lambheth formerly manifeſted preſident precept imitation one chiefe cauſe theſe innovation true rule de ſummo bono l 2 c 20 iſiodor hiſpalenſis dupliciter reus eſt qui apertè delinquit quia agit docet juſt verdict roman orator cicero de legibus l 3 pernicioſius de republica merentur vitiofi rectores quod non ſolum vitia concipiunt ipſi ſed ea infundunt civitatem neque ſolum obſunt quod illi ipſi corumpuntur ſed etiam quod corumpunt since preceeding innovation occaſions theſe corruption vniverſity muſt laid upon ſcore 2ly owne introduction ſelfeſame popiſh innovation vniverſity oxford lawes injunction ſelfeſame time little theſe ſprung cambridge ſtrong preſumption iſſued ſame roote 3ly owne chiefe favorite kinde 4ly chauncellor vniverſity rather obſtacle ſpeedy introduction theſe innovation otherwiſe appeares oxford preſcribed publique law injunction done cambridge becauſe chauncellor yet would need immediate viſitor archbiſhop canterbury conteſting authority majeſtic privie councell hee obtained decree patent succeſſors viſitors regard juriſdiction vniverſity viſitor likewiſe high commiſſioner hee wanted authority prohibit ſuppreſſe theſe popiſh novelty puniſh promotors certaine never countenanced advanced hee could ſhall manifeſted due place therefore old maxime law may take place gratian diſtinct 86 qui non vetat peccare cum poſſet jubet muſt bee really guilty theſe antichriſtian innovation vniverſities thus miſerably corrupted unſpeakeable prejudice church state ſince theſe two fountaines theſe popiſh ſuperſtitions corruption diffuſed themſelves dominion like moſt contagious leproſie foutes venero inficere eſt non tantum contra morem majorum ſed etiam contra fa deorum florus fountaines tranſcendent uſe excellency vniverſities wee ſhall next place purſue romiſh reinold 5 popiſh innovation ſuperſtitions cathedrall church unto cathedrall church hee began popiſh innovation intended introduce hee would never come within wall cathedrall yet notwithſtanding deane ſo violent deſpite biſhops direction oppoſition hee cauſed lord table removed placed altarwiſe eaſt end quire daughter tooke wife hee buryed ſame grave wife drawing towards end made laſt requeſt unto grandfather father ſelfe might buried together would charge erect ſome monument memoriall whereupon accompliſhment dying deſire mother fifteene child propounded unto lord archbiſhop dublin deane chapter saint patrick purchaſe place might erect tombe aſſigned ground arch make seller vault receive chapter seale ſo generall conſent legally intereſted therein made vault hewed ſtone ground conveighances therein free church water flood great raynes often anoyed withall earthen flower upper end chancell often overflowne rayſed ſame three ſteps higher making staires hewen ſtone paving ſame ſame whereon communion table ſtands dry gracefully seller placed corp wife grandfather father ſelfe daughter mine ſince deceaſed married lord digbie vault cauſed tombe foure ſtoryes erected reacheth two thirtie foot ground hath coſt thouſand pound leaſt greateſt ornament beautie church ever placed therein ſeated arch former time paſſage saint mary chappell eaſt end chappell high altar ſtood chappell hath two wayes one right hand left fell ruine arch wherein tombe placed keepe winde weather chancell made ſlight timber lathe plaiſtred clay white lymed whereon commandements lately written three yeares ſince worke finiſhed neither time worke ſince till late ever heare mouth opened againſt many commendation great beautie ornament chancell neither doth take away hide light chancell fabricke neither remembrance oldeſt man living ſay ever altar placed neere paſſage yet late hath pleaſed honourable lord lord deputy command give grace ſatisfaction herein elſe declare tombe muſt defaced done would bee greateſt diſhonour affliction could bee layed upon heard thing grace diſtant thereof preſence lord prymate given order deane ovvne charge ſtately skrene erected within quire upon pavement raiſed ſelfe upon tenne commandements bee engraven great beautifying god houſe vpon notice lord deputy made ſuite lord prymate lord archbiſhop dublin view place vouchſafed together deane chapter doe doe humbly offer grace opinion herein beſeech pious conſideration pleaſed returne ſuch anſwer may finally grace intreated take conſideration meritts noble earle zeale advancement true religion declared ſuppreſſing forreign juriſdictions preſumptions building church ſeverall place erecting schoolehouſes almeſhouſes owne charge beſides publike workes commonwealth raiſing ſtructures great ſtrength expence place importance planting engliſh colonyes great ſecurity ſettlement peace civility really believe lordſhip earle hath done well raiſe pave ſtone ſwelling tombe iron grate taking ſome ancient monument either ſide erecting skrine ſay communion table ſhould ſtand would take little roome quire muſt confeſſe doe well underſtand lordſhip addes skrine built communion table placed much beautifie quire like cathedralls ſay nothing muſt leave eyeſight judgement upon place whereas lordſhip ſayes lord leave deane chapter unanimous conſent erect monument place place fit monument conſent well askt given appeare place inconvenient lord corke well aske conſent deane chapter ill grant unanimous conſent worſe whereas write honourable perſonages whoſe memory preſerved monument ſay monument ſtand ought god forbid ſhould toucht ſtand ought may fairely decently removed ſet ſome convenient place upon ſide quire elſewhere well preſerve memory thoſe honourable perſonages mention doth god forbid violence ſhould offered kinde laſt whereas lordſhip deſires ſhould take conſideration merit noble earle willing doe firſt glad heare lordſhip zeale advancement true religion may conceale lordſhip likewiſe heard others ſome yeares ſince hee hath gotten hand ſmall proportion church meanes ſo man may ſee end advancing true religion ſuch zeale poore church hath little need god bleſſe every part church lordſhips building church schooles hoſpitalls know nothing ſay little ſay take church one place build church schoole hoſpitall another ti zeale way chriſtian bounty uſes tread lordſhip hath done publike worke ſtrength fortification kingdom pray god bee done church money howſoever lordſhip hath get full eſtate kingdome hee doth wiſely fortifie well hee beſides theſe long ſince heard though mention lordſhip hath done greater ſervice church ſome particular otherwiſe wherein ſtrong dore open ſhut occaſion ferveth locke keyes keepe boyes girles unreverent men woman dog kept comming bee ſoyle prophane lord table 9 chancell well paved c doth altogether lye upon flat hath note aſcents unto altar 10 church ſcaffolded every part theſe ſcaffolds ſo made annoy man feat hinder light window church chancell ſurrounded ſeates wherein pariſhioners commonly uſe ſit take roome much encroach upon propriety miniſter tit 3 ſacred utenſills churchornaments c sect 4 two faire large surpleſſes miniſter officiate divine service one may change waſhing alſo ſerve body buried head weſt note tit 7 sect 12 whereas offendeth many ſometimes call lordstable altar diſpoſe altarwiſe uſe phraſe sacrament altar oppugning whereof hath charged popery conſtantly ignorantly affirmed primitive note church named altar three hundred yeares chriſt give ſatisfaction herein hereabout prieſts people avow upon certain knowledge poore reading time articulate word table thrice uſed ever altar eccleſiaſticall writer within time onely dionyſius areopagita hath occaſionally aſſertion ſure cannot bee refelled therefore profeſſe doe follow courſe practiſe ancient primitive apoſtolicall church wee ought note traduce offended name thing uſe altar whereat manifold sacrifice offered god tit 8 sect 9 touching pariſhioners doth married woman within pariſh childbirth neglect giveth thankes god bee communion doth ſhee offer accuſtomed offering receive holy communion 11 pariſhioners ſort ſoever according church expreſly commandeth draw neere chriſtian humility reverence certifies many people complained troubled excommunicated predeceſſor biſhop wren comming receive rayls altar manner 19as many well kneele cloſe unto rayles come church upon knee receive prieſt ſtanding within rayles bread wine thus communicated riſe depart church many moe likewiſe kneele ſucceed communicated likewiſe depart courſe obſerved till received againſt ſay new unneceſſary troubleſome courſe enjoyned law required canon impoſed majeſty lord canterbury whoſe injunction profeſſe obey article injunction biſhop 20this perplexeth ſo muſt profeſſe troubleth wherein deſire reſolution direction caſe pretend poore opinion inter minutiora legis make beſt happily theſe time oppoſition amiſſe follow wiſe direction greateſt councel chriſtendom firſt nice let ancient cuſtoms obſerved 21if may bold deliver owne poore private opinion concerning caſe relate otherwiſe hold meere unneceſſary inconvenient comberſome irregular courſe know hath velam veſtigum note antiquity appeares saint chriſostome communicated communicant kneeling chancell diſtinct rankes doores ſhut none permitted depart till bleſſing pronounced ite peace 22i know law article advertiſements canon injunction require cannot tell came know note practiſe roman church leaſt italy rome yet drawes neere upon lee geneva diſcipline running banquet rightly named 23i humbly crave pardon free private opinion courſe upon ſo many dioceſſe doe ſtand24 otherwiſe profeſſe obedience church order doubt bring thereto ſettle therein almoſt durſt undertake account biſhop mountague ſhewed biſhop wren archbiſhop returned anſwer writing thereunto hee delivered archbiſhop whoſe study mr prynne ſeized 18the number ſtood excommunicated alleadged 13 1300 pariſhes 19when received bread wine two rankes quietly withdrew remained chancell would hold others kneeled downe roomes 20no marvell like thoſe pronounce new unneceſſary troubleſome service booke enjoynes requiring draw neer king himſelfe whole houſhold effect 21it bin neither perplexity trouble dioceſſe ere unawares bin declaimed againſt lordſhip hee came dioceſſe many faction prickt eares lordſhip plunged himſelfe openly get back hanſomely hee come dioceſſe findes ſo generally practiſed deſired beſt ſorts hoped upon private narration either lord grace king gainſay 21 fit reputed irregular cuſtome bin expreſt whether carry holy sacrament seat chancells receive communicant trouble ſucceſſive comming rayle chancell many chancells ſo ſeated cannot appeare communicant kneel truth faction hath greateſt ſticke many pariſhes populous chancel large chalice ſmall prieſt go againe ſo far renew cup much time labour loſt 22this ſuppoſition hold many chancells hold communicant much leſſe kneele conveniently come rayle hath analogy antiquity ſome men ſeene others england came chancell doores till lawes brought chancell rayle ſerves diſtinguiſh presbyterian chorus place saint chryſoſtome believe otherwiſe prove miſtaken 23 like practiſe roman church ſuppoſe better ſeeing note never found fault till geneva ti ſo like ape man yet farre enough man ſpoken unto precedent 24 biſhop mountague synod ipſwitch octob 8 1639 gave theſe enſuing direction clergie concerning people comming rayles receive copy whereof ſent archbiſhop received 21th ſame moneth appeares endorſement thereof came firſt dioceſſe much often troubled many many part thereof comming rayles called time holy communion novelty unto ſeemed ſelfe never note heard know meant underſtood length thoſe intend receive holy sacrament come church draw neere unto rayles incloſe altar communion table kneele many receive kindes miniſters hand company rayles received kindes riſe withdraw another company ſucceed place third ſo till bee ſort communicated courſe thus obſerved underſtand whether intend communicate together come church chancell diſpoſed ſitting ſtanding doe courſe repaire unto rayles returne thence whether onely ſo many doe together come church kneele rayles remaining church behinde untill courſe come goe know whether repaire riſen rayles whether ſome place chancell chancell church may bee comberſome inconvenient thing know contrary ancient tradition church man go chancel place received untill ite miſſa diſmiſſive bleſſing upon call peace god therefore give ſatisfaction cauſe becauſe yet never recuſant comming rayles unto mee refuſe come chancell receive upon knee obſerve service booke point onely cannot digeſt going comming downe diſquieting aſſembly neither doe ſelfe approve untill majeſty lord grace canterbury appoint otherwiſe note doe muſt hope ſubmit themſelves theſe order thought good quiet peace conformity direct firſt word exhortation pronounced aloud miniſter ſtanding communiontable pariſhioners yet church draw neere c intending communicate come church chancell courſe civility good order ſeemely beſt pariſh come firſt come chancell doore ſhut opened till communion done communicant departtill dimiſſion noncommunicant come amongſt boyes girles gaſers ſuffered looke play communicant entred diſpoſed ſeverall ſtations rankes formes firſt ranke ſtand ſit kneele neere cloſe unto rayles moſt eminent place beſt pariſh may fitly diſpoſed order decency though bee communicant alike holy communion yet confuſion bee avoyded firſt ranke thus diſpoſed behinde ſecond behinde third ranke may diſpoſed leaving ſufficient ſpace prieſt goe betweene giving firſt bread ſeverall communicant wine afterwards ſole aſſiſtant chiefe miniſter give bread aſſiſtant follow cup challice going altar firſt ranke ſerved whereas many chancells seat built pitty peſter chancell fit ſhould go untill ſeverall rankes filled whole chancell becauſe peradventure ſome zeale without knowledge diſcretion ſtubbornly refuſed come unto rayles neere impious leaſt ſuperſtitious come name one mr daye ipſwich doe require receive rayles next communion ſub paena juris reſt refuſers promiſed conformity thing riſing going downe neither require let noiſe behind threatning againſt chancelour mr ieffraye archdeacon salop selfe would make men thing obnoxious much afraid mine part thank god fear ſhall ready juſtifie ſelfe thing done whatſoever hath paſſed betwixt worſhip ſelf concerning lordſhip well prove need require much upon leaſt notice ready wait upon lord grace yourſelfe note perform michael coventry rayſed ſteps altar curious workmanſhip ſtone great charge making septum table yet hath lordſhip may perceive incloſed letter commanded table brought middle chancel holy time perhaps lordſhip ſay cancel fully finiſhed ſo much coventry might well come receive holy communion finiſhed table hath upper end ever ſince majeſties command mr byrd would knowne may yet juſtifie others alſo muſt worſhips commanded ever edward latham lichf 27 martii 1637 appears archbiſhop spy informer place certifie leaſt oppoſitions againſt innovation biſhops others manifeſted three letter firſt copy biſhop lincoln letter surrogate mr burdin martin communion afterwards iames wheeler falling preſently ſick dying profeſſing often death bed pennance ſubmiſſon ſo much againſt conſcience broken heart cauſe ſickneſſe death biſhop bathe wels preteſted nothing inſtance caſe ferdinando adam one churchwarden mary towre church ipſwich together fellow ferdinando adam caſe churchwarden titus camplin excommunicated henry dade one archbiſhops subſtitutes metropoliticall viſitation surrogate sir nathaniel brent archbiſhops name taking downe ſeates ſtanding communion table church railing table altarwiſe againſt wall injoyned sir nathaniel brent archbiſhops vicargenerall note metropoliticall viſitation proved excommunication ſelf read lord houſe theſe following word gulielmus providentia divina cant archeipiſe totius angliae prima metropolitanus ad quem omnis omnimoda iuriſdictio ſpiritualis eccleſiaſtica ad epiſcopum norwiſcenſ ſpectan pertinent ratione viſitationis noſtrae metropoliticae infra dioceſ norwic modo exercit notoriè dignoſcitur pertinere vniverſis ſingulis restoribus c ſalutem cum dilectus noſter magiſter henricus dade omnes ſingulas perſonas utriuſque ſexus quorum nomina cognomen inferius ſubſcribuntur recitantur c excommunicandos fore decreuit c vobis igitur firmiter injungendo mandamus quatenus praefatas perſonas preſcriptis ſic ut praefatur authoritate noſtra excommunicaetas pro ſic excommunicatis eccleſiis veſtris parochialibus diebus dominicis ac festivis poſt receptionem praeſentium immediatè ſequentibus tempore divinorum dum major ijſdem ad divina audienda ad fuerit populi elizabeth reigne expoſition aggens c 1 v 7 8 cap 2 v 2 3 determines thus popish beleeve biſhops doe teach place holy reſt hallowed ſay conjured water croſſings cenſings proceſſions c bleſſed god lord light word doth confound ſuch wicked fond fantaſies deviſe fill belly maintaine authority although theſe ceremony old law given moſes hardneſſe people heart keep thē exerciſed fall idolatry gentile yet mention new teſtament yet commanded either u forbidden uſed u longer ſhaddowes truth chriſt hath fulfilled taken away ſuch darke kind ceremony hath placed cleare light goſpell church continue end pope church hath thing pleaſant delight people goſpell preached knowing god pleaſed onely pure heart content honeſt place appointed reſort together though never hallowed biſhops written god dwels note p 85 86 87 theſe termes legat enim qui volet recentiores et noſtro praeſertim avo editos pontificales ac miſſales libros reperiet eos et caeremoniarū multitudine peragendi difficultate atque taedio et exorciſationis amentia priores illos longè ſuperare quibus enim non dicam verbis ſed portentis et ejuſ modi pontiſiciis adhuc adjurantur c dedicatio recentis eccleſiae altaria vaſa indumentum linteamina et ornamenta eccleſiaſtica hac omnia quam ſolemni ritu ſanctarum ſcripturarum ſententiis ad ſuas decantationes perperā adhibitis potificij peragunt paucis videamus c dedicatione eccleſiae jam exſtructae epiſcopus ter circumiens oſtium bacculo paſtorali ferit hoc pſalmi carmine attollite porta nota c cui diaconus intus exiſtens reſpondet fere exanimatus quis eſt iſte rex gloriae c deinde ingredicus epiſcopus fundamento eccleſiae cineribus ſparſo alphabetum gracum et latinum bacculo deſcribit tum variis multiſque epiſcopi clerique inceſsibus rectis obliquis retrogradis tranſuerſis paries ac pavimenta aqua sparguntur crux parietibus chriſmate cum dextro epiſcopi pollice depinguntur infinitis penè completis caeremoniis ad extremum precatur ut populus ea conveniens per ſacerdotum libamina caelesti ſanctificatione ſalvatus animae ſalutem perpetuam conſequatur diſcedens portam verbis epiſcopus ungit chriſmate porta ſis benedicta ſanctificata conſecrata conſignata deo commendata c altaria autem innumeris hujus generis precibus conſecrantur c et ſane valde deflenda eſt hujus temporis conditio quod eccleſiae patres eadem mentis acie ab eccleſia reſecare hujuſmodi caeremonias ſeu potius nugas aut nolunt aut non poſſunt qua priora illa ordalii vitia cernebant atque corrigebant ſed illis ut ſuperſtitioſis damnatis deletis hac quae mordicus retinent nota quamvis puerilia deliria ſint ex illis tamen fabricantur atque ſtruunt quanto modernis pontificibus aequior fuit gregorius qui ſcribit quomodo regulae ſanctorum patrum pro tempore loco perſona negotio inſtante neceſſitate traditae ſunt hi autem nulla neque temporis neque locus neque negotii neque perſonae neque cujuſquàm rei quàm ſuae voluntatis atque gloriolae rationem habentes ne puſillis rebus baptiſt concerning regiſters paſſage diary auguſt 28 1625 dy erat solis conſecravi capellam ſine oratorium propriis ſumptibus extructum demo communiter vocata aberguillehouſe nomen indidi capella joh baptiſtae gratam memoriam collegii joh baptiſtae oxon cujus primo ſocius dein praeſes fui et hoc conſultò feci intervenit autem aliud non mali ominis ſpero ſeems little dreamed beheading decollation baptiſt whoſe memory dedicated chappel could ill omen decapilation afterwards de quo nunquam cogitavi hoc fuit die sabbati veſperi immediatè praecedente conſecrationem celebrandam dum procibus eram intentus neſcio quàm violenter mientem irruit adeſſe diem decollationis johannis baptistae finitis precibus faſta conſului reperio diem illum diem lunae 29 ſcilicet auguſti non diem solis incidere optaſſem diem ipſum ſed gaviſus ſum consecrationem solennem peracturum vigilia saltem illivs diei nam illa die sereniſſimus rex jacobus cauſam meam circâ electionem preſidentem collegii joh baptiſtae oxon per tres integras horas ad minimum audivit è manu inimicorum potentum juſtiſſimè liberavit doubt preſerve • ar doome cenſure mr prynne depoſed found archbiſhops study paper indorſed corrected hand concerning conſecration chappell form act biſhop conſecrates chappell dedication dei nomine amen cum no gulielmus permiſſione divina menevenſis epiſcopus pia ac religioſa devotione ducti hanc capellam ſive oratorium intra aedes noſtras communiter vocatas aberguillihouſe infra parochiam de aberguillye com carmarthen noſtrarum menevenſis dioceſ iuriſdictionis continent inter muros ejuſdem longitudine ab oriente ad occidentem 30 pes latitudine ab aquilone verſus auſtrum 17 pes cum dimidio ſuper terris noſtris cum propriis noſtris ſumptubus noviter erigi extrui procuraviſſimus eandemque ſuggeſto menſa sacrum ſeu altari sedilibus convenientibus aliiſque neceſſariis ad divinum cultum decenter ſufficienter ornaverimus ad conſecrationē ejuſdem capellae auctoritate noſtra ordinaria epiſcopali jam procedentes eandem capellam divino cultui divinorum celebrationi ac tam ad sacramenta sacramentalia tum caenae dominicae tum etiam baptiſmatis ſacri eadem miniſtranda ad matrimonium ſolemnizandum quam ad divinas preces deo fundendas verbum dei purè ſincerè proponendum predicandum ac caetera omnia ſacra divina perficienda eadem quae de iure divino ac etiam legibus ſanctionibus constitutionibus eccleſiae noſtrae anglicanae ea parte ſunt requiſita neceſſaria ac ſi ſigiſtatim eſſent preſentibus ſpecificata modo forma ſimilibus jam de iure viſitatis dei honorem uſum noſtrum succeſſorum noſtrorum aliorumque nobiſcum aedibus noſtris praedictic ſive cum succeſſoribus noſtris impoſterum ibidem commorantium ſive inhabitantiū conſecramus dedicamus pernomen capellae sancti johannis baptiſtae et ſic conſecratam dedicatam aſſignatam eſſe futuris perpetuis temporibus remanere debere palam publicè pronuntiamus declaramus pernomen predictum perpetuis futuris comporibus nominandum appellandum fore decernimus ſic nominamus privilegiis inſuper omnibus ſingulis ea parte uſitatis requiſitis capellis abantiquo fundatis competentibus hujuſmodi capellam ſive oratorium ad omnem iuris effectum munitum eſſe volumus quantum nobis eſt de iure poſſumus ſic munimus ſtabilimus per preſentes salvo ſemper iure intereſſe matricis eccleſiae cujus parochia dictum capella ſive oratorium predict ſcita ſcituata est omnibus ſingulis decimis oblationibus vadiis proficuis privilegiis iuribus emolumentis quibuſcumque ordinariis extraordinariis ad dictam eccleſiam matricem iure
