ſeverall pariſhes within lymits ſuch ſhall offend keeping ſuch duely puniſhed iohn popham lord • hiefe iuſtice george sidnam knight henry barkley knight george speak henry waldron alexander colles iohn france alexander popham iohn lancaſter edward hext thomas phillips third order seſſions made county devon anno 1599 order agreed queenes majeſties iuſtices peace chapter houſe aſſembled 10th day january 1599 anno 41 elizabethae much appeareth many enormity modeſtie cannot expreſſed heretofore hapned church ale revells county devon therefore ordered churchales revells ſhall bee hence forth utterly ſuppreſſed contrary wiſe contempt order preparation made kept juſtices county forthwith ſend ſuch make preparation admoniſh make ſtay thereof upon refuſall behalfe proceeding therein bind make ſuch preparation good behaviour appeare next seſſions peace bee holden within county devon endure ſuch puniſhment either lawes realme order court ſhall bee inflicted upon contempt diſobeying order fourth following order made aſſizes devonſhire anno 1615 aſſizes held caſtle exeter iuly 24 1615 anno 13 jacobi c sir laurence tanneld serjeant mountague juſtices aſſize c ſeverall manſlaughters committed two churchales within county ſince begining preſent moneth iuly advertiſements given unto court continuall prophanation god sabbath theſe ſuch like unlawfull meeting miniſters unto court juſt occaſion note recite order formerly ſet downe reverend judge aſſize aſſizes holden county 19th day iuly yeare reigne soveraign lord king james grace god england france ireland king defender faith c 11th scotland 46th order followeth viz ordered court regard infinite number inconveniencies daily ariſing meanes revells churchales bullbaitings ſuch revells churchales bullbaitings henceforth utterly ſuppreſſed hereafter ſhall made known unto juſtices peace county ſuch ſet hereafter uſed juſtices peace within ſeverall diviſions take courſe well ſpeedy apprehending puniſhment idle lewde people drawne together ſuch place binding perſons uſing tipling inflicting puniſhment upon offender ſuch place diſcretion ſhall thought fit end order may better obſerved note ordered bee ſpeedily publiſhed every pariſh church within county fift order made ſame county anno 1627 order made sir iohn walter knight chiefe baron majeſties exchequer sir iohn denham knight juſtices aſſize c caſtle exon xxiii july 1627 whereas diverſe order bin heretofore made judge aſſize ſuppreſſion ale revel thoſe ſame order confirmed aſſize ordered court regard infinite number inconveniencies note daily ariſing mean revel churchales clerksales publike ale henceforth utterly ſuppreſſed hereafter ſhall made knowne juſtices peace county ſuch kept hereafter uſed juſtices peace within ſeverall diviſions take courſe well ſpeedy apprehending puniſhment idle vagrant people drawne together ſuch place binding perſons uſing ſuch tipling inflicting ſuch puniſhment upon offendors ſuch place law doth inflict end order may better obſerved ordered clerke aſſize ſhall leave copy hereof clerk peace sherriffe one every conſtable ſhall take copy ſeverall hundred liberty ſhall particularly note deliver copy 1627 upon petition diver miniſters honourable sir john denham knight one baron majeſties exchequor iuſtice aſſize county somerset humble petition miniſters whoſe name ſubſcribed sheweth whereas laſt george drake 15 marcii 1627 let clerke aſſizes draw like 〈◊〉 county iohn denham former order warranted ſo many preſidents iudge richardſon ſaid hee conceived hee power abſolutely reverſe commanded majeſtie much lay revoke yet doubted iuſtices peace would truly informe majeſty ground former order great diſorders occaſioned wake churchales majeſty would give order revive ever muſt make order made utterly voyde may lawfull perſons freely uſe lawfull recreation exerciſe ſuch meeting advice carefull outrage miſdemeanours commonly ariſing ſuch churchales clerkales wake revells done committed appeale caeſar publiſhed yeare 1625 firſt cauſe thoſe diſputes difference ſithence much troubled quiet church thought fitting take away occaſion calling ſaid booke therefore hereby ſtraightly command late learned sir humfrey lind hand much troubled thereat upon peruſall whereupon hee repaired maſter prynne lincolneſiaue booke deſiring take ſome paine give ſpeedy anſwer averred moſt dangerous book publikly cenſure highcommiſſion groſſe practiſe end whole kingdome might take notice arminian party thereby diſcouraged bookes ſeized greateſt part impreſſion vented called ſo ſlighty ſo private manner none took notice thereof therefore ſome publike cenſure ought paſſe upon book thus ſeized openly burnt elſe would monthes ſold openly againe corrupt people ſatisfaction given foule offence letter made aug 1631 letter biſhop vſher biſhop laud found ſtudy lambheth indorſed owne hand arreſted maſter prynne fully diſcovers hee ſole principall occaſion majeſtices letter calling booke hee ſeconded owne letter biſhop vſher purpoſe returned anſwer moſt honoured lord 8th october received letter 22 auguſt c laſt part lordſhips letter concerneth biſhop derryes book calling whereof 15th day october received majeſties letter dated woodſtocke note 24 auguſt whereupon preſently ſent warrant cauſed bookes left unſent england ſeized upon paſſe heretofore preſſe dublin eye unto becauſe province care j ſuppoſed properly belong unto brother dublin ſeeing majeſtic hath pleaſed impoſe charge upon god willing take order nothing hereafter ſhall publiſhed contrary unto majeſties ſacred direction ſeemeth lordſhip conceive lord derryes booke came ſince note hiſtorie gotteſchalchus whereas publiſhed halfe yeare whereby came paſſe coppies almoſt ireland england diſperſed prohibition came forth matter new lordſhip hath rightly obſerved long ſince preached saint paul church doctor bancroft lordſhips predeceſſour see time treatiſe perſeverance beene publiſhed doctor downams lecture upon 15th pſalme end booke partly intimated hiſtory gotteſchalchus lordſhip may ſee owne obſervation fully verefied prelate written againſt prelate synod againſt synod theſe thing could end untill ſides became weary contending ſure made lordſhip weary longere therefore high time end therefore craving pardon prolixitie humbly take leave reſt honour faithfull servant iace armachanus droghe da sermon preached saint mary upon 26 june laſt paſt fell upon delivery thoſe point majeſties royall injunction forbidden mee meddle withall therein hearty ſorrow confeſſe let fall ſome paſſages might bee taken diſparagement government church making erronious hereticall opinion way preferment maine currant diſcourſe might ſound ſedition eares preſent aſſembly great unexcuſable offence doe freely acknowledge deſerved ſharpeſt cenſures ſevereſt puniſhments therefore royall majeſtie hath juſtly rewarded forthe ſame offence ſo high nature nothing pleade royall mercy gracious soveraigne imitation policy firſt ingroſſed ſole power licenſing new bookes divinity owne chaplaines creature hand ſo nothing could paſſe preſſe publique approbation precedent approbation without danger ruine author printer stationer vender diſperſers becauſe feared experimentally diſcerned stationer printer reſtrained print new bookes againſt popery would preſently fall reprint old one formerly licenced authority prevent inconvenience popiſh party procured enſuing decree owne contriving ratified lord starrechamber ſent stationer print commanded punctually obſerve whereby monopolized ſole power authorizing divinity bookes preſſe himſelfe agent reſtrained reprinting book though formerly printed authority without ſpeciall review relicencing chaplaines decree intituled decree starchamber concerning printing made firſt day july 1637 imprinted london robert barker c 1637 decree printed order starchamber prefixed thereunto expreſly alleaged drawne penned advice moſt reverend father god ſold bookſellers ſhop paules churchyeard reading title thereof grew angry booke ſolid learned treatiſe popiſh maſſe ceremony accompaning ſaid hee wondered much archbiſhop would ſuffer ſuch bookes printed age adding perchance knew therefore would goe note lambheth informe thereof end might ſuddainly called ere diſperſed ſeemes performed accordingly next morning archbiſhop called booke ſtrictly ſending purſevants officer ſeize could meete underſtanding miſtreſſe griffin printed ſent lambheth angry manner demanded ſhe reprint book againſt maſſe time whether ſhe could find time print ſhe anſwered ſhe want work imploy ſervants elſe muſt ſit ſtill ſeeing could get good new bookes licenced demanded ſhee durſt reprint without new licenſe ſhe anſwered leave company stationer knew order contrary threatned high commiſſion told ſhe printed old book though formerly licenſed without review new licenſing chaplaines would put downe printing houſe ſhe ſhould never print againe though order contrary whereupon ſhe durſt proceed print reliques rome gave fully proved ſeverall oathes mr prynne michaell spark ſenior anne griffin ſuch archfavourer popery prelate grown would permit treatiſe engliſh proteſtant leſt popery ſuperſtition couched therein reteining orthodox pious licenced preſſe printed nicholas oakes 3 february 1636 doctor hayward archbiſhops chaplain inſtigation ſome popiſh perſons licenſed popiſh tranſlation booke ieſuite preſſe moſt likely archbiſhops approbation one theſe bookes formerly printed study produced maſter prynne endorſed owne hand forthwith entered stationer hall one w brooke popiſh stationer preſently ſent preſſe printed one part comming nicholas oakes houſe printed perceiving diver dangerous popiſh paſſages among others one touching pope ſupremacy repaired doctor hayward licenſed acquainted therewith deſiring purg theſe popiſh paſſages elſe durſt proceed print whereupon doctor checking making ſuch ſcruple bid go ſay nothing would beare ſave harmleſſe note danger might befall printing adding himſelf would preach much complained king therefore needed feare proceed whereupon oakes went book epiſtle dedicatory mr anne roper papiſt printed publiſhed eaſter 1637 neare time archbiſhop cauſed information exhibited starchamber sir john bank majeſties atturney generall againſt bastwick mr burton mr prynne one copy whereof comming mr pryns hand finding full popery ſuperſtition ſame old engliſh popiſh edition informed oakes others dr haywards word oakes complained inſerted licenſing printing popiſh booke among others croſſe bill starre chamber againſt archbiſhop chaplaines others popiſh confederate bill tendring lord keeper coventry admit archbiſhop getting poſſeſſion upon view thereof ſome complaint court againſt popiſh 1638 grace devoted iames croxton moſt reverend father god william divine providence lord archbiſhop canterbury lord primate metropolitan england letter thus endorſed archbiſhops owne hand received july 6 1638 mr croxton receiving confeſſion moſt apparent introducing auricular confeſſion ſpeciall deſigne archbiſhops proſecuted emiſſaries creature place gave exact account proceeding herein endeare themſelves favour end theſe doctrine practiſes auricular confeſſion prieſts abſolution thus urged maſter vvilliam tyndall practiſe popiſh prelate obedience christian man proteſtant vvriters informe u wit enſlave laity clergie advance prieſt king myter scepter eccleſiaſticall tribunall secular fiſh men ſecrets awe keepe bondage accompliſh owne deſignes upon facility doe popiſh kingdomes ſuch confeſſions abſolutions uſe thus done archprieſts maſterpeece confeſſion power prieſts remit ſinnes confeſſed wee ſhall proceed depends upon muſt neceſſarily followed great oppreſſion ignorant ſeduced people 2 uſe popiſh penance wearing hairecloth ſuch like corporall puniſhments enjoyned priest ſinnes confeſſed note intention ſatisfie god thereby ſinnes confeſſed lately preſſed lawfull profitable commendable uſe lawfulneſſe hereof never heard maintained church ſince reformation till archbiſhops domination thus preſſed juſtified commended theſe enſuing authorized bookes chriſts likewiſe hath marvellous efficacy ſtir u deſire devotion moderately uſed hairecloath tameth fleſh much upon principall dayes pennance one may well uſe adviſe diſcreet confeſſor dr pocklingtons altare wherefore would thee ſubject thy ſelfe unto without ſervile feare ſcruple thy conſcience diſpraiſing thine owne wiſdome councell ſubmit thy ſelfe governd judgment opinion whatſoever ſhall determine verumvultis reſpondere hoc utique dicere debetis quod non ſit minus verbum quàm corpus chriſti et ideo quantum ſolicitudone obſervamus quando nobis corpus chriſti miniſtratur ut nihil ex ipſo de noſtris manibus terram cadat tanta ſolicitudinc obſervamus ne verbum dei quod nobis erogatur dum aliquid cogitamus loquimur de corde noſtro pereat quia non minus reus erit qui verbum dei negligente nature ſubſequent ſo alſo prieſt altar thoſe bloudy ſacrifice unbloody prieſt derived aaron melchiſedech altar moſaicall sacrifice evangelicall viſible externall ſacrifices though none bloudy externall ſacrifices improper altar improper ſacrifice idlely dream ſacrifices prieſts altar relative ſelfe confeſſeth ſacrifice altar improper muſt need inferre even prieſthood improper alſo ieſuit doth ſay amount 6 body blood chriſt really ſubſtantially preſent euchariſt bread wine tranſubſtantiated francis sale introduction devout life determines thus p 194 219 death paſſion redeemer actually eſſentially repreſented holy ſacrince bleſſed saviour hath inſtituted venerable sacrament euchariſt containeth really verily fleſh bloud chriſts epiſtle devout soule thus ſeconds page 77 78 becauſe thou maiſt inflamed greater reverence love deſire towards bleſſed sacrament aſſure thee without doubt body sacramentally delivered unto thee received forme bread wherefore ſeeing ſame body carry glorified heaven ſeeing like unto even ſame ſeeing carry body dead bloud followeth neceſſity together ſame body muſt alſo conteined ſoule bloud grace vertues ſince word united muſt alſo follow whole trinity preſent sacrament truly verily heaven though another kind id eſt sacramentall forme ſame opinion thou muſt like ſort chalice newteſtament bloud conſider therefore thou haſt mee really perfectly page 238 make alſo every day honour holy sacrament bleſſed body two reverent adoration doctor laurence sermon king reſolves thus page 17 18 like thoſe ſay bodily ſo like thoſe ſay body becauſe chriſt ſaith ti saint paul ſaith ti church england ſaith ti church god ever ſaid ti truly ſubſtantially eſſentially way repreſentation commemoration yet without either con ſub trans antient church ſaid reall nevertheleſſe ſpirituall myſticall ſupernaturall preſentation exhibition ſhould saviour bid u take would u receive muſt beleeve ti muſt know faith may ſee ſence cannot ti miſtery ſay wont make uſe ſuch occaſions bleſſed ſucceſſe thought therefore grace mediation might pleaſe ſacred majeſty cauſe generall synod whole three kingdomes indicted wherein reverend biſhops chiefe learned neighbour could ſort excellent effect ſo might bee convinced abſurd errours leaſt publikely world cenſured condemned remainder ſhame ſhall made bluſh owne miſerable tranſportation would bee ſome comfort thoſe exiled biſhops put holy iland heare ſame uſe whereto imployed firſt plantation goſpell receptacle perſecuted prelate ſhould ſee cauſe taken heart whole church majeſties dominion ſhould think preſence authority grace eminent learned primate armagh ſo many grave renouned prelate ſeconded ſo irreſiſtable power learning judgment ſo many aſſiſtant divine great note worth cannot chooſe certainly confound theſe heady ignorant oppoſers government good order give great ſatisfaction world ſeeing errours groundleſſe proceeding theſe men ſhall hiſſe countenance neither ſhelter themſelves example church france netherlands c since neceſſity hath long agoe caſt condition theſe men eſtabliſhment right forme wilfully drawn upon themſelves impetuous excluſion ſetled government certainly lord thinkes ſhould kinde neceſſity courſe ſince ſome whole church scotland hath thus broken schiſme ſhamed ſelfe goſpell without ſome timely prevention miſchiefe may yet grow whereas way may leaſt choakingly convinced ſeaſonably checked neither neede charge hereof great majeſties coffer ſince burthen commiſſioners may layd upon ſeverall dioceſſe whence ſent grace ſees whither zeal hath carried bold forward thus preſuming humbly crave pardon grace hath extended greater errours hope good heart excuſe beſt wiſhes whereof truely vowed duly paid grace grace faithfull obſervance command jos exon doth much overvalue grace know great weakeneſſe ſo well know little ſtrength grace would ſingled ſo high noble undertaking confeſſe holy zeale cauſe man ſhall outſtrip ability many yet ſince note hath pleaſed grace honour ſo farre thinke mee capable worthy ſuch imployment ſhall moſt gladly without prejudice able paine endeavour beſt way would grace bee pleaſed give mee leave ſuggeſt another motion themſelves thus chriſtians lived thoſe part world beene lately diſcovered therefore never partake reſt catholike church yet doubt thoſe may ſaved fiftly nothing ſo proper chriſtians love charity man may damned well want charity want faith cannot bee poſſible greater want charity exclude men salvation therefore apt owne ungodly malice damne others certainely themſelves damned let ſuffice man ſhall irrationall reaſons alteration aſſertion p 39 took duty lay king onely power reaſon command onely aggravate extenuate juſtifie fact juſtification reſts ſolely upon king command warrant excuſe guilt opinion herein ere obeyed king though maſter burton maſter prynnes ready obey majeſty command finally admit majeſty commanded make theſe alteration yet owne cauſe open court juſtice law ought preſent iuſtifie theſe alteration world print moderate anſwer ſeditious ſcandalous chalenges see ſpeech starchamber p 73 heylins preface henry burton ſtiles written ſpeciall command licenſed chaplaine p 150 157 ordered christopher dowe ſecond herein innovation unjustly charged upon preſent church state p 136 14 • thus writes secondly ſay alteration thoſe prayer done ſame authority firſt ſet forth neither anyother inferiour ranke question humble reverence ſubmit judgement think wiſer farre fit order thoſe thing belong place neither concernes indeed know reaſons move either doe alter anything particularly objecteth againſt former would hereby jeſuits papist termed babyloniſh antichriſtian sect restraine ſome mentally transferre thoſe puritanes cry downe babylon popery charitable respect thoſe religion peaceable honeſt men doubt ſome whatſoever maſter b beleeves ſuch willing think fit pray rooting confuſion papiſts indiſcriminatim thoſe harſh termes ſurely charitably minded christian cannot approve ſuch alteration ground man transferring puritanes meer ſurmiſe falſe ſlander thoſe intimate doe call rome jeruruſalem popery true catholique religion yet know ſuch furious cryers downe popery maſter b hath ſhewed himſelfe may accounted baby note loniſh antichriſtian sect well jeſuit world may pray better reaſon maſter b would men doe thoſe title againſt hierarchy church god would root land c wherein make zealous oppoſers popery thoſe world ſtiled puritanes dangerous perſons fitter rooted land babyloniſh antichriſtian sect papiſts jeſuits thus juſtifie alteration ſo daring without exception anſwered faire way win papiſts therefore muſt uſe harſh phraſes againſt adding theſe paſſages would give offence thoſe religion therefore unleſſe would yeeld expunged would mean licenſe book sir edward replyed father executor truſted writing would never conſent ſhould ſo mangled would printed none yet perſwaſions friend could uſe would prevaile unleſſe theſe clauſes omitted naught would licenſed whereupon sir edward went archbiſhop himſelfe acquainted premiſes earneſtly deſiring grace treatiſes might printed without theſe purgation would much muilate treatiſes prejudice author archbiſhop gave anſwer sir many imployments buſie truſted chaplaines thoſe thing muſt repaire sir edward preſſing againe would licenſe unleſſe theſe paſſages raſed archbiſhop anſwered referre wholy chaplaines many imployments ſelfe therefore thinke fit done muſt ſubmit unto whereupon theſe treatiſes ſtopt printing till sir edward ſome two three yeers got printed oxford yeere 1639 without wrong weak labour ſuffered theſe obliteration diſgrace diſcredit bath reflected upon ſelfe alſo thereby thoſe ignorant abuſes done licenſer muſt need impute abſurdities non ſenſe lame imperfect ſalvation reprobate ſaith saint f gregory without •• unds church although ſeem within pale faith farre •• e repentance faith god bringeth none theſe ſaith saint aug conc pel l 5 c 4 idem de un • ecleſiae c 23 hoc donum proprium eſt corum quireg • abunt cum chriſto mat 13 5 8 auſtin healthfull ſpirituall repentance whereby man reconciled god farre charity gift holy ghoſt ſaith ſame father peculiar proper ſhall reigne chriſt faith hypocrits reſembled saviour ſeed ſowne upon ſtony ground becauſe root ſoone withered true faith ſeede ſowne good ground took deep root downward humility grew 6 conſciences troubled ſinne whether ought miniſters take oath ſecreſie rather induce men confeſſe freely two thing conſidered reſolution queſtion viz firſt whether lawfull 2 whether expedient firſt muſt conſider whether lawfull take ſuch oath ſecreſie firſt thinke man denies except anabaptiſts generall lawfull god law take oath either firſt aſſertory ſecondly promiſſory upon weighty cauſe though magiſtrate secondly although poſitive law threaten premunire impoſeth oath without authority yet know danger aſſumes willingly voluntarily thirdly whether particular oath againſt lawes want skill determine one ſide concealment ſome caſes make man acceſſary though fact may performed muſt promiſed eſpecially oath ſide ancient canon church forbid upon great penalty reveale confeſſions law 1 eliz confirme canon oppoſite word god ſuppoſe secondly muſt conſider whether expedient take ſuch oath greater queſtion muſt reſolved ground moving whatſoever lawfull muſt judged fit unfit hypotheſi therefore although ſhould grant church light world yet anſw 1 would follow thence alwayes viſible theſe two cauſes viz firſt becauſe sunne moon ordained great light gen 1 16 pſ 136 8 governing day night yet ſee often darkned ſuffer ſtrong eclipſes ſo church though ordained enlighten world miniſtring doctrine scripture yet ſometimes may faile men ſights hath ſhewed elſewhere viz upon matth 5 14 secondly though church light yet ſuch walk darkneſſe loving better light doe alwayes ſee went either eye thereto thus king aram ſouldiers neither ſaw horſes chariot fire round eliſha knew midſt samaria untill eye opened secondly minor propoſition falſe alſo although light church granted yet true chriſt saviour ordained alwayes light world according verſe yee light world theſe word ſpoken hold true catholike church alwayes viſible becanus undertakes prove parable thus chriſt compare church net obj caſt ſea gather ſorts fiſh ſome cannot underſtood viſible church becauſe proteſtants hold two church one inviſible viſible doe thus diſtinguſh inviſible onely thoſe predeſtinated unto ſalvation namely viſible good bad mixed together church saviour ſpeaks hereof good bad commixed therefore ſpeaks viſible church yea alſo true church therefore true church viſible firſt falſe proteſtants hold two diſtinct true church secondly becanus fight owne ſhadow concluding nothing againſt u anſw 1 neither queſtion betwixt u whether true church chriſt viſible whether catholike church viſible diſtinguiſh ratione praedecati ratione ſubjecti true church partly viſible partly inviſible catholike inward church chriſt called viſible becauſe although perſons viſible yet ſo conjunction chriſt head internall work faith ſeen secondly compleat moſt univerſall church abel unto world end may decline hatred perſecution reviling ſpeeches secondly ſome partly weary c ibidem printed booke fol 178 written copy fol 79 quest muſt ſo preach god may gaine glory thereby anſw done three manner wayes yet chriſt ſends thoſe moſt backward difficultly perſwaded yea perſwaded embrace ſo ſinnes may full mature unto harveſt hence obſerve preaching word often ſent unto many deſtruction evidently appeares viz water spirit b fire c firſt baptiſme compared water hath theſe two principall property firſt waſheth cleane cleanſeth away filth pollution garment therefore muſt examine try whether waſhed cleane purged pollution • inne secondly moyſteneth maketh apt fructifie bring forth fruit iſa 44 3 therefore muſt try whether barren encreaſe work ſanctification yet truly baptized unto chriſt b secondly baptiſme compared unto spirit wind breath • e property theſe two namely firſt coole refreſh lung ſecondly work inſenſibly according saviour ſpeech john 3 wind blowes liſts afterwards proper place viz page 27 90 theſe clauſes deleted ye light world papiſts affirme scripture hard difficult obſcure common people laity cannot understand therefore purpoſe read againſt produce place arguing briefly thus apoſtles light world therefore doctrine e scripture perſpicuous facile may underſtood diligent obſervant reader c bellarmine anſwer firſt major propoſition falſe every light alwayes viſible theſe two cauſes viz firſt becauſe sunne moone ordered great light gen 1 16 pſal 136 8 governing day night yet ſee often darkned ſuffer ſtrange eclipſes ſo church though ordained enlighten world miniſtring doctrine scripture yet ſometimes may faile men ſight hath ſhewed elſewhere viz upon matth 5 14 secondly though church light yet ſuch walke darkeneſſe loving better light doe alwayes ſee want either eye thereto thus king aram souldiers neither ſaw horſes chariot fire round eliſha knew midſt samaria untill eye opened neither men light candle put buſhell papiſts ſay scripture ſo hard obſcure although people permitted read mother tongue yet could poſſibly underſtand therfore boot ſo againſt tenet enforce place arguing thus chriſt former verſes affirmed apoſtles ſale earth alſo light world verſe ſhewes abſurd thing light candle put buſhell uſefull put candleſtick becauſe ſo give light houſe writing apoſtles obſcure muſt neceſſity confeſſe light hid buſhell ſeen thoſe roome abſurd let paſtiſts acknowledge abſurd opinion think scripture obſcure rather affirme perſpicuous plain yea perſpicuous clear underſtanding ſome houſe faithfull briefly goſpell like lighted candle put primati metropolitano ac aliis quibuſcunque epiſcopis quorum hac parte intererit ſalutem cum vacante • uper ſede epiſcopi ciceſtren per mortem naturalem vltimi epiſcopi ejuſdem ad humilem petitionem licentiae noſtrae perdilectum nobis chriſto richardum mountague ſacrae theologia baccalaurum ſibi et eccleſia praedicta elegerunt epiſcopum paſtorem prout per literas ſuas ſigillo corum communi ſigillatas nobis inde direstas plenius liquet apparet no electionem illam acceptantes eidem electioni regium noſtrum aſſenſum adhibuimus pariter et faverem et hoc vobis tenore praeſentium ſignificamus rogantes ac ſide et dilectione quibus nobis tenemini firmiter precipiendo mandautes quatenus vos eundum richardum mountague epiſcopum et paſtorem eccleſiae cathedralis noſtrae ciceſtren pradictae fie vt praefertur electum electionemque praedict confirmare et cundem epiſcopum et paſtorem eceleſiae cathedralis predictae conſecrare ceteraque omnia et ſingula peragere quae veſtro hac parte incumbunt officio paſtorali juxta formam ſtatutorum et legum regni noſtri angliae hac parte edit • et proviſ velitis cum diligentia favere effectu cujus rei c conteineth majeſties royall aſſent richard william • cher man ſo ſoon could procured friend ſhe warrant come bring one phiſitian chirurgian unto let blood permiſſion repair unto ſickneſſe longer ſtrict cloſe impriſonment ſaid archbiſhops another generall collection granted privy signet ſeventeenth iune ſixteenth year king james anno dom 1618 reliefe inhabitant town weſell printed authority together archbiſhop abbot direction concerning ſame ſeverall biſhops dated june 25 1618 wherein finde theſe following expreſſions city place ſuccour reliefe many afflicted ſtrangers ſuch exiled trʋe religion able longer ſuſtaine charge neither miniſtry freeſchoole heretofore erected propagation trʋe religion c ſhould excite u enlarge bowel compaſſions toward cannot better expreſſed part compaſſion fellowfeeling making profession faith yet doe ſuffer ſuch adverſity c ſame terminis thoſe expunged patent cauſe clauſe ſhould thought ſo inſufferable ſo impaſſible archprelate certainly muſt ſome great myſtery iniquity predeceſſor abbot ſelfeſame opinion proteſtant church religion abbot deemed church religion true ſame laud deemes church religion true religion ſame time though formerly one ſame ſo becauſe himſelfe altered perverted yea almoſt quite ſubverted deſign execution intending ſet popery old true religion therefore ſuffer ſuch patent paſſe great seal preſſe majeſties name ſhould proclaim religion true religion together profeſſe bound conſcience maintain uttermoſt power confederate bent might ſuppreſſe commend ſincerity conſtancy true religion might enjoyed eſtates fortune backſliders time tryall would ſubmitted themſelves antichriſtian yoak renounced diſſembled profeſſion true religion theſe dayes confederate endeavoured make men backſliders apoſtates perſwaded ſubmit themſelves antichristian yoak renounce diſſemble profeſſion true religion would quite croſſed fruſtrated deſign therfore muſt obliterated whatever come finally obſerve imbittered malice proteſtant church grand affection pope church rome moſt evidently diſplayed expunction firſt deleating thoſe clauſes ſtyle true religion c latter expunging expreſſion favour roman church pontife would ſubmitted themſelves antichristian yoak elſewhere page 263 dilated upon briefe thus would proteſtant church church god chriſt miniſters miniſters religion true religion ſame muſt certainly expreſſe abundance malice diſaffection theſe engliſh anno 1637 ſtrictly called ſeized purſevants high affront prince palatine newly arrived england church becauſe declared thoſe church orthodox judgement cenſure againſt ſundry arminian popiſt errours innovation ceremony hee confederate laboured introduce among u atteſted upon oath michael spark ſenior mr prynne never heard popiſh book sanctum clara others printed either called ſeized ſpeciall voluntary command countenanced yea reſtored agent ſeiſed searcher stationer let world judge prime peece evidence manner proteſtant archbiſhop ill ſtood affected proteſtant religion 3 theſe premiſes conſidered wonder endeavoured policy power ſuppreſſe nay abrogate priviledges immunity dutch french church kingdom granted majeſty royall anceſtors part accompliſhed prejudice next part charge twelfth article ſhall preſent ſummary accompt king edward ſixth letter patent dated 24 day iuly fourth yeare reigne granted enſuing patent dutch french proteſtants living exile london eſtabliſhing church presbyterian government among themſelves exempt epiſcopall iuriſdiction appointing superintendent miniſters patent rarity thereof better underſtanding charge ſhall large tranſcribe edwardus sextus dei gratia angliae franciae hiberniae rex fidei defenſor terra eccleſiae anglicanae hiberniae ſupremum caput omnibus ad quos praeſentes literae pervenerint ſalutem cum magnae quaedam graf conſiderationes no ad praeſens ſpecialiter impulerunt tum etiam cogitantes illud quanto ſtudio charitate chriſtianos principe sacroſanctum dei evangelium religionem apoſtolicam ab ipſo chriſto inchoatam inſtitutam traditam animatos perpenſos eſſe conveniat ſine qua haud dubio politia civile regimen neque conſiſtere diu neque nomen ſuum tueri poteſt niſi principe caeterique praepotentes viri quos deus ad regnorum gubernacula ſedere voluit id imprimis operam dent ut per totum reipublicae corpus caſta ſinceraque religio diffundatur eccleſia vere chriſtianis apoſtolicis opinionibus ritibus inſtituta adulta per ſanctos ac carui mundo mortuos miniſtros conſervetur pro eo quod chriſtiani principis officium eſſe ſtatuimus inter alias graviſſimas de regno ſuo bene ſplendide que adminiſtrando cogitationes etiam religioni religionis cauſae calamitate fractis afflictis exulibus conſulere sciatis quod non ſolum praemiſſa contemplantes eccleſiam à papatus tyranide per no vindicatam priſtina libertate conſervare cupientes verumetiam exulum peregrinorum conditionem miſerantes qui jam bonis temporibus regno noſtro angliae commorati ſunt voluntario exilio religionis eccleſiae cauſa mulctati quia hoſpites exteros homines propter chriſti evangelium ex patria ſua profligatos ejectos regnum noſtrum profugos praeſidiis ad vitam degendam neceſſariis regno noſtro egere non dignum eſſe duximus cujus liberalitas nullo modo talus rerum ſtatu reſtricta clauſave eſſe debet quoniam multi germanae nationis homines ac alii peregrini qui confluxerunt dy ſingulos confluunt regnum noſtrum angliae ex germania aliis remotioribus partibus quibus papatus dominata evangelii libertas labefactari premi coepta eſt non habent certam ſedem locum regno noſtro ubi conventos ſuos celebrare valeant ubi inter ſuae gentis moderni idiomatis homines religionis negotia re eccleſiaſticas pro patrio titu intelligenter obire tractare poſſint idcirco de gratia noſtra ſpeciali ac ex certa ſcientia mero metu noſtris nec non de aviſamento concilii noſtri volumus concedimus ordinamus quod de caetero ſit erit unum templum ſive ſacra aedes civitate noſtra london quod vel quae vocabitur templum domini ieſu ubi congregatio conventus germanorum aliorum peregrinorum fieri celebrari poſſit ea intentione propoſito ut à miniſtris eccleſiae germanorū aliorum que peregrinorum sacroſancti evangelii incorrupts interpretatio sacramentorum juxta verbum dei apoſtolicam obſervationem adminiſtratio fiat templū illud ſive ſacram aedem illam deuno superintendente quatuor verbi miniſtris erigimus creamus ordinamus fundamus per praeſentes et quod idem superintendens miniſtri nomine ſint erunt unum corpus corporatum politicum de ſe per nomen superintendentis miniſtrorum eccleſiae germanorum aliorum peregrinorum ex fundatione regis edwardi sexti civitate london per praeſentes incorporamus ac corpus corporatum politicum per idem nomen realiter ad plenum creamus erigimus ordinamus facimus conſtituimus per praeſentes et quod ſucceſſionem habeant et ulterius de gratia noſtra ſpeciali ac ex certa ſcientia mero motu noſtris nec non de aviſamento concilii noſtri dedimus conceſſimus ac per praeſentes damus concedimus praefato superintendenti miniſtris eccleſia germanorū aliorū peregrinorū civitate london totum illud templum ſive eccleſiam nuper fratrum auguſtinentium civitate noſtra london ac totam terram fundum ſolum eccleſiae pradict excepto toto choro dictae eccleſiae terra fundo ſolo ejuſdem habendum gaudendum dictum templum ſive eccleſiam ac catera praemiſſa exceptis praeexceptis praefato superintendenti miniſtris succeſſoribus ſuis puram liberam eleemoſinam damus ulterius de aviſamento praedicto ac ex certa ſcientia mero metu noſtris praedictis per praeſentes concedimus praefato superintendenti miniſtris succeſſoribus ſuis plenam facultatem poteſtatem authoritatem ampliandi majorem faciendi numerum miniſtrorum nominandi ac appunctuandi de tempore tempus tale hujuſmodi ſubminiſtros ad ſerviendum templo praedicto quales praefato superintendenti miniſtris neceſſarium viſum fuerit et quod haec omnia juxta beneplacitum regium volumus praeterea quod johannes alaſco natione polonus homo propter integritatem innocentiam vitae ac morum ſingularem eruditionem valde celebris ſit primus modernus superintendens dictae eccleſiae et quod gualterus de laenus martinus flanders franciſcus riverius richardus gallus ſint quatuor primo moderni miniſtri damus praeterea concedimus praefatis superintendenti miniſtris succeſſoribus ſuis facultatem authoritatem licentiam poſt mortem vel vacationem alicujus miniſtri praedictorum de tempore tempus eligendi nominandi ſurrogandi alium perſonam habilem idoneum locum ſuum tamen quod perſona ſic nominatus electus praeſentetur ſiſtatur coram nobis haeredibus vel succeſſoribus noſtris per no haeredes vel ſueceſſores noſtros inſtituatur miniſterium praedictum damus etiam concedimus praefatis superintendenti miniſtris succeſſoribus ſuis facultatem authoritatem licentiam poſt mortem ſeu vacationem superintendentis de tempore tempus elegendi nominandi ſurrogandi alium perſonam doctum gravem locum ſuum tamen quod perſona ſic nominatus electus praeſentetur ſiſtatur coram nobis haeredibus vel succeſſoribus noſtris per no haredes vel succeſſores noſtros inſtituatur officium superintendentis praedictum mandamus firmiter impungendo praecipimus tam majori vicecomitibus aldermannis civitatis noſtrae london note epiſcopo london succeſſoribus ſuis cum omnibus aliis archiepiſcopis epiſcopis iuſticiariis officiariis miniſtris noſtris quibuſeunque quod permittant praefatum superintendentem miniſtros ſucceſſores ſuos liberè quietè frui gaudere uti exercere ritus ceremonias ſuas proprias diſciplinam eccleſiaſtitam propriam peculiarem non obſtante quod non conveniant cum ritibus ceremoniis regno noſtro uſitatis abſque impetitione perturbatione aut inquietatione eorum vel eorum alicujus aliquo statuto actu proclamatione iniunctione reſtrictione ſeu uſu contrarium inde antehac habitum factis editis ſeu promulgatis contrarium non obſtante eo quod expreſſa mentio de vero valore annuo aut de certitudine praemiſſorum ſive eorum alicujus aut de aliis donis ſive conceſſionibus per no praefatis superintendenti miniſtris succeſſoribus ſuis ante haec tempora factis praeſentibus minime facta exiſtit aut aliquo statuto actu ordinatione proviſione ſive restrictione inde contrarium factis edictis ordinatis ſeu proviſis aut aliqua alia cauſa vel materia quacunque aliquo non obſtante cujus rei teſtimonium litteras noſtras fieri fecimus patentes teſte meipſo apud leighes viceſſimo quarto die iulii anno regni noſtri quarto per breve de privato sigillo de dat praedict authoritate parliamenti ſignatum p southwell et eſt ſigillatum sigillo regio ſubappenſo copy patent found archbiſhops ſtudy ſhall ſubioyne theſe enſuing order paſſages favour confirmation patent queen elizabeth king iames king charles reignes preſented archbiſhop miniſters theſe forraigners church letter privy councell church london containing theſe word ann 1573 non ignoramus variis eccleſiis varios diverſos jam ab initio chriſtianae religionis ſemper fuiſſe ritus ac ceremonias dum hi ſtantes illi genu procidentes alii proni procumbentes adorant precantur tamen eadem pieta eſt ac religio ſi verè ad verum deum oratio tendat abſitque impietas ac ſuperſtitio c non contemnimus ritus veſtros neque vos ad noſtros cogimus probamuſque ceremonias veſtras ut vobis veſtrae reipublicae unde orti eſtis aptas convenientes order privy councell 29 iune ann 1574 others would joyne themſelves ſaid church ſuch perſons ſhall counſelled betake themſelves ſome part kingdome may commodiouſly received doe willingly call former commandement anſwer king iames french dutch miniſters 21 may ann 1603 ie vous protegeray ainſi quie convient un bon prince de maintenir deffendre tous ceux qui ont abandone leur patrie pour la religion mou deſire eſt de vous deffendre comme fait la reyne • ur qui vous receu eu ſo • royaume pour laquelle vous avez prie dieu que ſi aucun vous trouble ou moleſte pleignez vous en amoy ie vous maintiendray perpetuity granted dutch colcheſter ann 10 jacobi 17 october ann 1612 alſo order church aſſemblies tending good government ſaid congregation free large ample manner reſpects intent conſtructions purpoſes heretofore uſed hath tolerated allowed unto according true intent preſent ordinance proviſion juriſdiction contrary thereof wiſe notwithſtanding order privy councell french church canterbury ſecond may ann 1613 ſaid congregation within city canterbury ſhall according majeſties gracious pleaſure peaceably freely enjoy ſuch priviledges liberty immunity permitted uſe aſſemblies congregation ample manner heretofore hath allowed time queen elizabeth ſince order king james ſignet 13 iune ann 1616 theſe therefore command court iuſtice loving subject permit ſuffer ſaid ſtrangers member outlandiſh church child enjoy continuance favour declared behalfe conſidering loving kindeneſſe good entertainment subject child doe receive finde beyond sea order privy councell walloones norwich 10 october ann 1625 thoſe norwich although borne kingdome ſhall continue ſaid church society ſhall ſubject ſuch diſcipline hath time fifty five yeares practiſed among ſhall refractory ſhall bound appeare board gracious anſwer king charles deputy forraigne church 30 april ann 1623 thank aſſure continue unto ſame favour king father ſhew unto hope marriage ſhall dammage unto rather occaſion much good countrey men order king charles ſtrangers 13 novemb ann 1626 command iudges c permit ſuffer ſaid ſtrangers member outlandiſh church child quietly enjoy ſingular ſuch generall impeachment touching religion thus expreſſed tenth originall article hath traiterouſly wickedly endeavoured reconcile church england church rome effecting thereof hath confederated diver popiſh prieſts jeſuits hath kept ſecret intelligence pope rome himſelfe agent instrument treated ſuch thence received authority instruction hath permitted countenanced popiſh hierarchy eccleſiasticall government establiſhed kingdome traiterous malicious practiſes church kingdome hath exceedingly endangered hath like fall tyranny roman sea ſomewhat amplified ſeventh additional article ſhall conuex thereto prove article ſhall lay downe make good two groundworkes precedent evidence hath ſufficiently cleered firſt archbiſhop hath beene generally reputed perſon popiſhly affected papiſt heart while reſident univerſity oxford ever ſince beleeved reported ſuch one popiſh party rome elſwhere beyond sea wonder therefore endeavoured reconcile reduce church england church rome prove arch biſhop reputed papiſt while reſident oxford ſhall produce two witneſſes credit knew well ſome neere relation ſince firſt doctor danel featly depoſed viva voce barre archbiſhop while remaining oxford hence theſe ſeverall paſſages diary may 11 1625 die mercurij primo mane dux buck verſus mare ſe tranſtulit obviam iturus reginae mariae galliam dedi ad ducem eo die literas ſed quae properantem ſequerentur maij 19 die jovis literas ſecundas miſi ad ducem buck tunc pauliſper morantem pariſijs maij 29 die solis literas tertias dedi manus epiſcopi dunelmenſis qui cum rege iturus traderet ea duci buck ad litus applicanti junij 5 die pentecoſtes mane inſtanter iturus ad ſacra literas è gallia à duce clariſ buckinghamiae manus meas ſe dedere reſponſum dedi aurora proxima junij 12 die solis bow church london sir nathaniel brent vicar generall archbiſhop canterbury whoſe right viſited mar 1636 ſaid sir nath publike charge miniſters bearing uſed theſe word whereas diver prayer sermon uſe voluntates c contremiſcunt oſſa mea dum hoc recogito morbus ubi ſpiritus vitales opprimuntur nempè ut fides radix vitae corrumpitur difficilime ſanatur hic morbus noſter remedium tamen illud efficax à samaritano noſtro deſignatum reperimus nec aliud niſi illud dic ecclesiae dico eccleſiae definitiones majeſtati veſtrae propono sanctorum patrum venerabilium doctorum expoſitiones novorum ineptijs praepono quas dum modeſtè retego chriſto • ego ſaniem nonſcalpendo ſed ſuavitèr lambendo lavo ut abluam sacro vestro imperio opus quippe ut executioni mandetur quod ab eccleſia sanctis patribus ſancitum eſt ſecundum illud juſtiniani conſtit 42 haec decrevimus sanctorum patrum canones ſecuti hoc tua majestate dignum hoc dignitati cauſae conſonum hoc saluti animarum prorsus necessarium et ſhall evidence firſt author owne expreſſe confeſſion pag 338 inſtudui ut vides note pie lector reconciliare articulos confeſſionis anglicae determination ibus ecclesiae catholicae non ecclesiam ipsis ex quâ collapſi ſunt sed ipsos ecclesiae qua dei opitulante gratia ſalvandi ſunt ducendos censui corticem verborum ſubinde cenſurâ graviori dignum cenſebis ſenſum ocrò latitantem quem elicui non adeò veritati diſſonum niſi alio detorquere malint recte judicabis tamen verborum novitatibus chriſtum lacerum inſpexi tunicam inconſu • ilem diſſutam diſſectam reperi quis non condoleret quis non redintegrationem suaderet omnibus modis ſi poſſet persuaderet hic unicus scopus meus c omnia eccleſiae ejus ſub chriſto capiti pope quâ del eo reverentiâ ſubmitto ʋltro obteſtor deum sanctos ejus hoc qualicunque opello noſtro animarum ſalutem per fidei redintigrationem intendere quod deus per viſcera domini noſtri jeſu chriſti ad interceſſionem omnium beatorum opportunè efficiat et serenissimum londini pridie calend auguſti give teſtimony book▪ fateor c ſed laudaſſe conſilium propoſitum tuum quod eccleſiae utilitatem ceſſarum auguror ad conciliandos errantium animos ſi deus opt max caeptis tuis annuat quod spero precorque thomas blaclo profeſſor divinity 5 julij 1633 give verdict libellum qui ſic inſcribitur articuli confeſſionis anglicanae paraphraſticè exponuntur c ex zelo fidei animarum ſcriptus omnibus concordiae et pacis christianae amicis non poteſt non eſſe acceptus cum catholico animo calamo ſcriptus ſit errantibus ut ad christi caulam note reditum inveniant facem catholicae veritatis quaſi ex propinquo ad alliciendos puſillanimos oſtentet william tomſon doctor divinity writes 20 aprilis dignum praelo cenſuit ſperans inter protestantes ſaltem moderatiores fructuri futurum p papiſt profeſſor divinity 16 april 1633 give approbation tractatum hunc perlegi c verè ſecundum calculum meum publicatio operis protestantibus moderatioribus arridebit omnibus pla ere difficilimum et ad note readvnationem cum ecclesia romana dum opportunum fuerit disponet interim reverentiorem ejus eſtimationem inuret praeſertim reliquos confeſsionis anglicae articulos quod optarem eadem moderatione exponere vellet ad calcem hujus operis ſi pro voto ſucceſſerit lectorem ſpe caterorum foveres atteſted agree original david monachus decanus congregationis caſinenſis olim problem concerning great controverſie juſtification thus publiſheth agreement conſent page 157 158 159 haec doctrina eorum noſtra nec plus dant fidei quam concilium trid quoad juſtificationem ſi cautè exponantur c hîc ergo facilima pax ineunda ſic enim montacutius articulum de fide rectè explicat c nulla igitur differentia quoad hoc punctum ecce igitur plane et plene note convenimus et hinc ut patebit quaeſtione ſequenti doctiores proteſtantes tribuunt juſtificationem noſtram intrinſecam habitui juſtitiae non ergo fidei imo haec noſtra poſitio ſolenniter cantabrigiae comitijs anniverſarijs pro actu doctorali haec anno currente menſe julio agitata probata eſt thus ſeconds page 181 quibus omnibus benè penſatis ſanè nulla hodiè reperietur differentia confeſſione anglica sanctiſſima diffinitione trid nihil enim articulis hamptonienfibus oppoſitum ordinatur ʋt patet artic 9 de juſtificatione ʋnde montacutius ſuo appello caeſarem ca 6 expreſſe probat doctrinam noſtram ſaltem ſecundum gradum hujus latitudinis ab ipſis teneri ibidem rectè adducit doctorem white aſſerentem juſtificatione peccatoris duas eſſe actiones dei unam quâ remittit peccatum alteram qua poteſtatem dat homini reſiſtendi peccatis quae poteſtas eſt ipſa charitas infuſa cordibus noſtris per illam ſecundam actionem dei quae eſt ipſiſſima doctrina noſtra hic igitur pax point falling grace 30 problem juſtus poteſt finaliter note peccare page 209 210 211 brings 16 article booke homily juſt cited mountague appeale prove juſtified perſon may fall grace ſinne finally concluding thus et certè omnes confeſsiones aliarum nationum ferè conſpirant cum ovarello collatione hamptonienſi montacutio ſuâ appellatione cauſabono epiſtola ad bertium cum reliquis omnibus melioris notae 36 problem concerning supererogation miſconſtruing fourteenth article church point blank againſt word ſenſe concludes thus page 253 interim â nobis ſtant confeſſio anglicana ejus genuini ſequaces hic ergo pax utinam pax illa non quam mundus dat quae ſingulis horis novitate opinionum violatur ſed quam chriſtus ſuis apoſtolis legavit c 37 problem concerning invocation saint lawfulneſſe writes thus page 260 montacutius de hoc ſubjecto agens momentis rationum monamentis authoritatum oppreſſus â veritate ſtat alij frequentèr de agitur non ſolum inter no concordia ſed ni fallor inter celebriores ex adverſarijs ut poſted melius patebit proſecutes page 273 274 275 276 record quoad reliquiarum crucis chriſti venerationem profitetur andreros reſponſ ad cap 18 peronij cauſabonus exercitationibus baronij ad 34 cultus etiam ſeu venerationem quandam honoratiorem sacrarum imaginum cum chryſoſtomo ſua liturgia id eſt inclinationem religioſam ad imaginem aſtruit poſt alios montacutius reſponſoria ad heighamum appello caeſarem cap 22 concludes page 277 hîc igitur cum confeſſione anglica erit pax omnimode modò non ex affectu partium ſed veritatis omnia pro dignitate perpendent cloſing deus natura gratia thus quibus ſi omnia rectè perpenderit lector eruditus magnum futurae readunationis specimen note perspiciet pag 278 paraphraſeth 39 article endeavouring reconcile u tenet church rome pag 316 317 31 article againſt ſacrifice maſſe gloſſeth thus nulla prorſus hîc erit difficultas cum doctioribus proteſtantibus qui planè hoc totum fatentur ʋt videre eſt apud andreros contrâ perronium montacutium contra heigham alios frequenter denique nec hic articulus ullatenus adverſatur cum enim ipſi fateantur eccleſiá eſſe sacerdotes eſſe etiam sacrificia propitiantia fateantur neceſſe eſt nam heb 5 omnis sacerdos conſtituitur ut offer dona ſacrificia pro peccatis hic igitur necessario pax ad pacem verò hanc altius ſtabiliandam examinemus naturam ſacrificij c eſt igitur ſacrificium ſed cum termino illo note reſtrictivo â patribus uſurpato incruentum quod non negant pag 334 et eo plus quo video celebriores proteſtantium doctores sacerdotes ſacrificia agnoſcere 25 article concerning homily pag 321 thus ſhakes homily biſhops owne tearmes nec tenentur proteſtantes ob haec verba articulo ſtatim ſingula verba vel ſententias homiliarum jurare c prudenter igitur quae ſanam doctrinam ſapiunt populo legenda alia neglectui habenda pape 332 37 article concerning power civill magiſtrates againſt pope juriſdiction writes thus montacutius contr heighum alij eorum doctiſsimi quibuſcum de hoc egi nullam utique juriſdictionem ſpiritualem regibus noſiris concedunt ſed gubernium civile temporale indirectè per accidens ob pacem reipubl perſonas cauſas eccleſiaſticas extenſum gaviſus ſum etiam valdà note de illo quod etiam diebus factum eſt cantabrigiae comitijs pro actu doctoroli ubi summo pontifici ut maximo patri ſic enim eum appellabant deſignata eſt cura ſpiritualium regi temporalium licet ſub fine ſubjiciebatur regum eſſe omnes regere quod intelligi debet civiliter non ſpiritualiter modò â nobis explicato pag 334 335 336 handle theſe three queſtions firſt whether power withdraw themſelves ſubjection obedience sea church rome upon occaſion secondly whether realme ſufficient cauſes doe thirdly whether well exceed meaſure therein reſolves two latter thus ʋtraque quaeſtio ſi • e dubio graviſsima eſt maximum meretur diſcuſsionem quod ſi cauſa ſufficiens non fuerit vel terminus juſtae ſubſtractionis exceſſerint quantum pericula tàm diuturno ſciſmate hinc utique omnia quantacunque praecidendae unitatis nulla eſt juſta neceſſitas lib 2 cont epiſt parm utinam denvo authoritate publica pro dignitane puritanis non intermixtis note ex affectu readunitionis perpenderetur ad hoc ſinguli evoluant auguſtinum contra donatum scio illos hoc abhorrere de quibus dicit caſſander licet haud ſatis affectus romanae ecclesiae plerique ex eis qui ſibi ab evangelio nomen ſumpſerunt cum partem qua vetus catholicorum ecclesiae romanae nomen retinet prorſus aſpernantur omnem que ejus communionem defugiunt nec ut membra ejuſdem corporis amore miſericordia proſequuntur quod no puritanis c read followeth lord deputy covnsell henry falkland foraſmuch cannot take notice late intermiſſion legall proceeding againſt popiſh pretended titulary archbiſhops biſhops abbot deanes vicar generall againſt majeſties subject authority derived see rome colour teaching keeping schooles pretended monaſteries colledges doe train youth kingdome ſuperſtitious religion great derogation contempt majeſties regall power authority great offence many majeſties good subject contrary lawes eccleſiaſticall government kingdome impoveriſhment majeſties subject ſame theſe therefore require majeſties name ſtraightly charge command manner ſuch pretended titulary archbiſhops biſhops deanes vicar generall archdeacon others deriving pretended authority power juriſdiction see rome every forbeare henceforth exerciſe ſuch power juriſdiction authority within kingdome ſuch abbot pryors jeſuits fryars munks nunnes others ſort aforeſaid doe forthwith break convent houſes fryars colledges monaſteries place whereſoever ſhall conventually collegiatly aſſembled together within kingdome relinquiſh ſame diſperſe ſeparate themſelves every order named prieſts whatſoever doe henceforth firſt giving good ſecurity attend board within ten dayes notice given aforeſaid ſhall diſcharged impriſonment enjoy liberty without moleſtation trouble meſſengers majeſties officer whatſoever whereof secretary windebankes paper materiall read bar bull pope himſelfe give title ſufficient evidence sir toby jeſuit prieſt dilecto filio tobiae matheo societat jeſu sacerdoti urbanus papa 8 dilecte fili ſalutem apoſtolicam benedictionem ardens animarum zelus quo jam toi annis vinea domini laborando ſtrenuum te militem exhibuiſti note promeretur ut tuae virtuti debitam laudem reddamus sane magnâ cum exultatione audivimus see rome maſterpeece p 19 20 21 labores quos ſuſtines ut ſedis apoſtolicae amplitudinem augeas quo ca ritatis zelo omnibus omnia fias ut omnes lucrifacius decet certè te viram apoſtolicum magni apoſtoli exemplo doctum ut judeis fias tanquam judeus ii qui ſunt ſine lege tanquam ſis finè lege dummodo sedis apoſtolicae dignitatem promoveas ideo cum magnam brittanniam mittere ſtatuerimus dilectum filium comitem roſſeti noſtrum sedis apoſtolice cum poteſtate legati latere nuntium juvinem zelo dei accenſum apoſtolicae ſoliciuudini noſtrae ſatisfactum credidimus ſi eum tuae curae note committeremus juſſimus igitur ut tibi • mmunicet inſtructiones ſibi datus dilecto filio nepote noſtro franciſco sanctae reverendiſ eccleſiae card barbarino ſubſcriptas teque ab eo quo pro ſede apoſtolica zelo ardes rogamus quantum opus eſt tibl mandamus ut praedictum filium nuntium noſtrum omnibus dirigas moneas inſtruas lapſus errores ejus qui per juventutem facilè accidere poſſunt corrigas ut ſedis apoſtolicae decor inviolatus permaneat ut denique omnibus ei te angelum cuſtodem prebeas magnam certè ſpem concepimus predictum filium note nuntium tuis conſilii • adjutum non parvo eccleſia catholica fructus producturum labora igitur dilecte fili opus fac evangeliſtae miniſterium tuum imple catholicos zelo dei accende ipſos comforta ſed praecipue amazones ill quae ut dilecto filio georgio conneo audivimus die ae nocte ſtrenuè decertaut pro dignitate ſedis apostolicoe non diffidimus de domino neque de potentia ejus quia ſicut occaſione q elizab unius faeminae authoritas ſedis apoſtolicae regno angliae ſuppreſſa fuit ſic nunc per tot haeroicas faeminas illas imitantes quae à galileo ſequebantur dominum ſocietatem ejus aſſidiue ſequentes brevi codem regno reſtituenda ſit adhortare igitur illas ut opus aggreſſum viriliter proſequantur de ſede apoſtolica quae devoti feminii ſexus peculiarem curam gerit bene mereri pergant rogamus patrem domini note noſtri jeſu chriſti ut tibi ſpiritum ſanctum ſuum mittat qui te omnibus per omnia cuſtodiat apoſtolicam noſtramque benedictionem dilecte fili iterum atqúe iterum tibi impartimur datum romae apud petrum ſub annulo section debate point queſtion whether lawful chriſtians image hiſtories men body perſons trinity making whereof formerly concludes great wickedneſſe thus propounds reſolves verùm illo quoque diſcrimine omiſſo ullas omnino imago ſivè quae re geſtas ſive quae hominum corpus figurent habere templis chriſtianis expediat obiter expendamus principio ſi quid no movet veteris eccleſiae authoritas meminerimus quingentis circiter anuis quibus magisadhuc florebat religio ſyncerior doctrina vigebat chriſtiana templa fuiſſe communiter ab imaginibus vacuum ergo tunc primùm ornamcutum templorum aſcita ſunt quum miniſterii ſynceritas nonnihil degeneraſſet non diſputabo ecquid rationis habuerint qui primo ſuerunt ejus rei authores verùm ſi atatem cum aetate conferas videbis illos multum declinaſſe ab eorum integritate qui imaginibus caruerunt quid paſſuros fuiſſe putamus ſanctos illos patres eccleſiam tandiu ea carere quam utilem ac ſalutarem eſſe judicarent certe quia videbant ea aut nihil aut minimum utilitatis plurimum autem ſubeſſe periculi repudiarunt magi conſilio ratione quam ignoratione aut negligentia praetermiſerunt quod etiam auguſtinus claris verbis teſtatur quam ſedibus locantur epiſt 49 lib 4 de civitate dei c 31 inquit honorabili ſublimitate ut à praecantibus atque immolantibus attendantur ipſa ſimilitudine animatorum membrorum atque ſenſuum quamvis ſenſu anima careant afficiunt infirmos animos ut vivere ac spirare videantur c pſal 113 et alibi hoc enim facit quodammodo extorquet illa figura membrorum ut animus corpore vivens magi arbitretur ſentire corpus quod ſuo ſimillimum videt c paulo poſt plus valent ſimula • hra ad curvandam infaelic • animam quodos ooulos aures pes habent quàm ad corrigendam quòd non lequuntur neque vident neque audiunt neque ambulant haec ſanè videtur cauſa eſſe cur 1 ioan 5 21 johannes non tantùm à ſimulachrorum cultu ſod ab ipſis quoque ſimulachris cavere no voluerit et no horribili inſania quae ad totius ferè pietatis interitū orbem ante hac occupavit plus nimio ſumus experti ſimulat que templis collecantur imago quaſi ſignum idololatriae erigi quia ſibi temperare non poteſt hominum ſtultitia quin protinus ad ſuperſtitioſos cult • delabatur quòd ſi nec tantum periculi immineret quam tumen expendo quem uſum deſtinata ſint templa neſcio quomodo indignum mihi videtur eorum ſanctitate ut alias recipiant imago quàm viva illas iconicas quas verbo ſuo domini • conſecravit baptiſmum intelligo coenam domini • um aliis ceremoniis quibus oculos noſtros ſtudioſius detineri vividius affici convenit 253 254 objected thoſe sir anthony hungerfords book doctor baar chaplaine would obje 5 expunged sir edward hungerford sonne complained depoſeth expoſtulated chaplaine would croſſe licenſe bookes whereupon told many imployments trusted chaplaines thoſe thing wholly referred therefore thought fit leave muſt submit thereupon would redreſſe grievance herein anſwer firſt errour herein mine faith cannot make reformed church different religion eſpecially ſince argues starchamber speech papiſts religion one though differ ſome private tenet yea deniall proteſtants religion forraigne part true religion contends rome true church argues virulency againſt one good affection thirdly calling declaration palſgraves religion directly punctually proved act impudency therefore deny policy remember fourthly purgation revocation letterspatents onely confeſſeth ſhameleſly juſtifies moſt undutifully laying blame ſcandall king himſelfe naught therein inſtigation upon two falſe ſcandalous
